0.title: Neha Dhupia felicitated at Miss India to mark 20 years of her win
0.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia was felicitated at the 2022 Femina Miss India finale by her parents to mark 20 years since she won the title in 2002. Neha was also joined on stage by her husband Angad Bedi and their two children. The Miss India Instagram page shared pictures, writing, "Thank you Neha Dhupia, for being...a mentor to our ladies."

1.title: I wanted to run away in the first year of my marriage: Farah Khan
1.article_body: Choreographer-filmmaker Farah Khan made an appearance at 'Swayamvar-Mika Di Vohti'. Speaking about singer Mika, Farah said, "Mika is a very sensitive person, only a sorted girl can handle him. I feel...you should marry when you find the right person." Sharing her own experience, she said, "I wanted to run away in the first year of my marriage."

2.title: Gauri Lankesh's murder trial begins in Bengaluru court
2.article_body: Almost five years after she was murdered, journalist and activist Gauri Lankesh's murder trial began at a Bengaluru sessions court. The 55-year-old editor of Lankesh Patrike was shot dead outside her home in September 2017. Of the 18 accused, 17 have been arrested, and the court will hear the matter for five days during the second week of every month.

3.title: Maha state power discom removes 5 meter-reading agencies
3.article_body: Maharashtra's state power distribution company MSEDCL has terminated the services of five private meter-reading agencies after finding negligence in taking the readings, the company said Monday. It added, "Three agencies are from Solapur district, while two are from Pune district." All electric meter-reading agencies are currently under scrutiny from MSEDCL following complaints of discrepancies.

4.title: Payments startup slice appoints Sudeep Behari as its Business Head
4.article_body: Payments startup slice has appointed Sudeep Behari as its new Business Head. With Behari having more than 16 years of experience in the credit finance industry, slice said that the decision was taken with the aim of expanding the company's services to a wider audience. Prior to joining slice, Behari was leading the ICICI-Amazon credit card partnership.

5.title: Crypto exchanges' trading volume falls by 70% in 3 days as TDS rule takes effect
5.article_body: Trading volumes on Indian cryptocurrency exchanges declined by at least 70% in three days after the new rule requiring 1% tax deduction at source on every transaction came into effect on July 1. Trading volumes on WazirX were down the most at 82%, as per data from Crebaco. Meanwhile, ZebPay and CoinDCX saw a decline of 76% and 70%, respectively.

6.title: Wore 8-9 pairs of black jeans for song Duniya Haseenon Ka Mela: Bobby
6.article_body: As Bobby Deol-starrer 'Gupt' completed 25 years, the actor recalled shooting for his song 'Duniya Haseenon Ka Mela'. He said, "I would rehearse so much that I was drenched in sweat by the end of it." "And then white patches would be visible because of it. I wore eight-nine pairs of black jeans for that one song," he added.

7.title: India Women record their highest stand vs SL Women in ODIs, win series
7.article_body: Smriti Mandhana and Shafali Verma's 174-run first wicket partnership helped India Women beat Sri Lanka Women by 10 wickets in second ODI in Pallekele to take a 2-0 lead and win the three-match series. Notably, it's India's highest partnership for any wicket against the hosts in ODIs. Smriti's 94* and Shafali's 71* helped the visitors chase 174 in 25.4 overs.

8.title: Dead man wins sarpanch polls in MP, authorities look for solution
8.article_body: A deceased man has won sarpanch elections in a village in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar district. The man, Ravindra Thakur, passed away due to cardiac arrest on June 22, but his name appeared on ballot papers for July 1 polls as authorities weren't informed, an official said. "We've sought the opinion of the state election commission," Sagar Collector Deepak Arya said.

9.title: Tripura CM Manik Saha to take oath as MLA on July 8
9.article_body: Tripura CM Manik Saha will take oath as MLA on July 8, Tripura Assembly speaker said on Monday. He added that Saha met Rajya Sabha chairman and Vice President, M Venkaiah Naidu, to tender his resignation as Rajya Sabha MP on Monday. Saha had won the by-election from Town Bardowali assembly seat, after assuming office as CM on May 14.

10.title: Media landscape has changed in past few years: Thakur
10.article_body: BJP leader Anurag Thakur on Monday said that the media landscape has changed in the past few years and the emergence of digital media has made information accessible. However, he cautioned against the challenges, including the spread of misinformation and competition for traditional mediums. COVID-19 pandemic became infodemic and this problem arose globally, Thakur added.

11.title: Video shows Sidhu Moosewala's shooters waving guns, celebrating in car
11.article_body: A video showing shooters accused of killing singer Sidhu Moosewala waving guns and celebrating in a car is being widely shared on social media. The video was reportedly found on a phone of one of the accused shooters. The shooters in the video are Ankit Sirsa, Priyavrat, Kapil, Sachin Bhivani and Deepak, according to ANI.

12.title: Was suppressed for long time; won't resort to vendetta politics: Shinde
12.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Monday said that the rebellion led by him was a fallout of the unfair treatment meted out to him, but added that he won't resort to vendetta politics. "I alone had closed down 16 ladies' bars in and around Thane. There are some 100 various criminal charges registered against me," he said.

13.title: India has eliminated all queues by going online: PM at Digital India Week
13.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, speaking at Digital India Week 2022 in Gujarat, on Monday said, "India has eliminated all queues by going online." "Eight to 10 years ago, we had to stand in queues...to pay bills, for ration, for admission, for exam results, in banks," he added. "Government's Digital India programme has given relief to poor from corruption," the PM said.

14.title: Don't make us seek an independent Tamil Nadu: DMK's A Raja
14.article_body: DMK MP A Raja on Monday demanded that Centre should grant 'state autonomy' to Tamil Nadu and not push party to seek an independent country. Raja, who made these remarks while addressing party's local body representatives in Namakkal, said that DMK won't rest until demand is fulfilled. Meanwhile, fellow party leader TKS Elangovan said that Raja made comments in "frustration".

15.title: Few focused on why there's Modi's pic on vaccination certificates: PM
15.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday criticised Opposition leaders who questioned his picture on COVID-19 vaccination certificates. "The world is discussing how we managed to give COVID-19 vaccination certificates to people just after they got jabbed, but few people were focused on why is there Modi's photo on these certificates," he said. PM Modi was speaking in Gujarat.

16.title: India issues statement, asks Canada to remove film poster showing goddess Kali smoking
16.article_body: Amid controversy over Leena Manimekalai's documentary film Kaali's poster, which shows the goddess smoking, the Indian High Commission has issued a statement saying they've urged the Canadian authorities to withdraw all provocative material. India said it received several complaints. Manimekalai had tweeted the poster while informing about the documentary's screening at Toronto's Aga Khan Museum.

17.title: Salman Khan to launch Yo Yo Honey Singh in Bollywood: Reports
17.article_body: Actor Salman Khan will reportedly launch singer Yo Yo Honey Singh in Bollywood. According to reports, the rapper will be seen in Salman's forthcoming film 'Bhaijaan'. As per reports, Salman has given the responsibility of songs for the film to Honey and Devi Sri Prasad. The project marks Honey Singh’s first collaboration with Devi Sri Prasad, reports added.

18.title: BJP uses criminal elements for its own propaganda: Mehbooba Mufti
18.article_body: PDP President Mehbooba Mufti alleged that the BJP is using criminal elements to perpetuate its propaganda of "communal division and hatred." Referring to media reports claiming that the murderer of the Udaipur tailor, and an LeT terrorist arrested from Jammu had links to the BJP, she said that had these been associated with Opposition leaders, multiple FIRs would be filed.

19.title: Andhra minister requests PM Modi, CM for selfie at event; video surfaces
19.article_body: After PM Narendra Modi addressed a public meeting in Andhra Pradesh's Pedamiram on Monday, state Tourism and Culture Minister RK Roja requested him and Chief Minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy for a selfie. PM Modi and the CM obliged and posed for a picture. Earlier in the day, PM Modi said Andhra Pradesh is the land of heroes and patriots.

20.title: It was an opportunity to bat all-overs: Powell on his 61* vs Bangladesh
20.article_body: Contributing to his team's 35-run win against Bangladesh in second T20I, West Indies batter Rovman Powell said he took the opportunity to advance the score and bat all-overs. "Platform was already set by captain [Nicholas Pooran] and Brandon King...I think they played well before I got to the crease," he added. Batting at number five, Powell scored a 28-ball 61*.

21.title: Fourth crew member of ship that sank off Hong Kong coast rescued
21.article_body: A fourth crew member of the engineering ship that sank near the coast of Hong Kong on Saturday was rescued on Monday. According to Guangdong maritime authorities, the crew member was rescued by a navy ship and is in stable condition. The China-registered floating crane Fujing 001 sank in the South China Sea after being hit by Typhoon Chaba.

22.title: Ukrainian flag raised on Snake Island after Russian retreat, pic surfaces
22.article_body: The Ukrainian flag has been raised again on Snake Island, days after Ukraine claimed to have driven the Russian forces out of the area. A picture of the flag installed on the island located in the Black Sea has also been shared online by Ukrainian officials. Russia's Snake Island withdrawal could loosen its blockade on Ukrainian ports, experts have said.

23.title: Pant creates record for scoring most runs in an overseas Test by an India wicketkeeper
23.article_body: Team India wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant has set the record for scoring most runs in an overseas Test by an India wicketkeeper. The 24-year-old set the record by aggregating 203 runs in the rescheduled fifth Test against England at Edgbaston. The previous record was set by Vijay Manjrekar, who had scored 161 runs against West Indies in Kingston, Jamaica in 1953.

24.title: What can consumers do if any hotel or restaurant levies service charge?
24.article_body: Consumers can request hotels or restaurants levying service charge to remove it from the bill amount, the government has said. Consumers can also lodge a complaint on National Consumer Helpline by calling 1915 or through the mobile app. Further, they can file a complaint against unfair trade practice with the Consumer Commission or submit a complaint to the District Collector.

25.title: Amarnath pilgrim critically injured after falling off pony, airlifted by Army
25.article_body: The Indian Army on Monday airlifted a 50-year-old critically injured pilgrim undertaking the Amarnath Yatra from the Brarimarg helipad on Baltal track in Jammu and Kashmir to the nearest medical facility. The man sustained injuries after his pony lost balance and he fell down around 100 feet towards Sindh river, officials said. The pilgrim was returning to the base camp.

26.title: New Maha govt won't last long, many contradictions in it: Cong leader
26.article_body: Congress leader HK Patil on Monday said that the newly-formed Maharashtra government under CM Eknath Shinde "won't last long" as there are too many "contradictions" in it. "Shiv Sena MLAs are restless. The way they have travelled so much shows they are not united," he added. Patil stated that Congress will remain a part of Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA).

27.title: Magnitude 4.4 earthquake hits Andaman & Nicobar Islands
27.article_body: A 4.4 magnitude earthquake had hit the Andaman & Nicobar Islands on Monday, the National Center for Seismology confirmed. According to data provided by the agency, the earthquake's epicentre was located 256 km South-East of Port Blair, at a depth of 10 km. Earlier in the day, a 3.2 magnitude earthquake hit J&K, as per the agency.

28.title: ED attaches 16 properties worth ₹137 crore of B'luru-based real estate firm
28.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Monday said it has provisionally attached 16 immovable properties worth ₹137.60 crore of Bengaluru-based real estate firm Dreamz Infra India Limited in connection with a scam. The scam was exposed in 2017 after police found that at least 5,000 people were cheated of ₹1,500 crore. Three prime accused in the case have already been arrested.

29.title: Video shows Rahul offering food to woman, later hugging her in Kerala
29.article_body: The Congress party has shared a video showing party leader Rahul Gandhi offering food to a woman at an eatery during his visit to Kerala's Wayanad. The video shows Rahul asking his colleague KC Venugopal, "Why can't she sit with us...Does she want tea?" The Congress leaders then offered her food, following which Rahul hugged her.

30.title: NIA chief meets Amit Shah over Udaipur, Amravati killings: Reports
30.article_body: National Investigation Agency (NIA) chief Dinkar Gupta reportedly met Union Home Minister Amit Shah at his office over the two killings in Rajasthan's Udaipur and Maharashtra's Amravati. This comes after the Ministry of Home Affairs directed the NIA to take over the investigation of the two murders. The MHA said that the conspiracy behind the killings would be probed.

31.title: 10,000 female aspirants register for Navy's Agnipath scheme till Sunday
31.article_body: Around 10,000 female aspirants registered themselves for the recruitment of sailors in the Indian Navy under the newly introduced Agnipath scheme till Sunday, according to government officials. The registration process began on Friday. This is the first time that women will be inducted as sailors in the Indian Navy. Online application for recruitment is scheduled to open on July 15.

32.title: SC to hear plea on AIADMK leadership row on July 6
32.article_body: The Supreme Court will hear a plea by former Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Edappadi K Palaniswami on July 6. The plea challenges a Madras High Court order staying the passing of resolutions in AIADMK General Council Meeting. The plea will be heard subject to clearance from Chief Justice NV Ramana, vacation bench of Justices Indira Banerjee and JK Maheshwari said.

33.title: I was first choice for 'Ghajini', but didn't like the story: Madhavan
33.article_body: Actor R Madhavan has revealed that he was the first choice for 2005 Tamil film 'Ghajini' but rejected it because he did not like the story. The role was portrayed by Suriya. "'Ghajini' becoming a hit was a very big thing," the actor added. The film was remade in Hindi in 2008 starring Aamir Khan and Asin.

34.title: Large number of fish found dead in Delhi's Najafgarh drain, samples collected
34.article_body: A large number of fish were found dead in the upstream stretch of Najafgarh drain along Delhi-Haryana border in the last few days. "The number of dead fish could be in lakhs. It could be due to the release of an excessive amount of pollutants," a forest department official said. Water samples from the drain have been collected for testing.

35.title: Bodies of 5 Army personnel killed in Manipur landslide sent to home stations
35.article_body: The mortal remains of five Territorial Army personnel, who were killed in the landslide in Manipur's Noney district, were sent to their respective home stations by an IAF aircraft on Monday. The deceased personnel were accorded full military honours at the Imphal airport by senior Army and Assam Rifles officials. The death toll in the incident has risen to 42.

36.title: SriLankan Airlines' ops to be impacted due to fuel crisis: Report
36.article_body: Sri Lanka's national carrier SriLankan Airlines' flight operations will reportedly be impacted till July 18 due to a crunch in jet fuel supplies amid the country's economic crisis. The airline reportedly ran out of available jet fuel stocks on June 29. Notably, Sri Lanka has barred the sale of fuel, except supplies required for essential services, till July 10.

37.title: What are the highest successful run chases against India in Test cricket history?
37.article_body: India have set a target of 378 runs for England in the rescheduled fifth Test at Edgbaston. The record for the highest successful run chase against India in Test cricket history is held by Australia, who chased down a 339-run target in Perth in 1977. It is followed by target of 276 runs (West Indies) and 240 runs (South Africa).

38.title: Laxman to coach Team India in first T20I against England: Report
38.article_body: Ex-India batter VVS Laxman will reportedly coach Team India in first T20I against England in Southampton. The National Cricket Academy (NCA) Director was appointed as India's head coach in the side's recently concluded two-match T20I series against Ireland. Laxman was given the responsibility because the regular head coach Rahul Dravid was with India in England for the rescheduled fifth Test.

39.title: Reminds me of SpiceJet jeans, kurti uniform: SpiceJet ex-COO on Akasa crew uniform
39.article_body: SpiceJet's former COO Sanjiv Kapoor reacted to the newly-released look of Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air's crew uniform, saying, "Love the sneakers!" Kapoor said, "(It) reminds me of the casual jeans and kurtis weekend uniform we had introduced at SpiceJet in 2014." He added, "Casual and fun works well for low-cost carriers (LCC). Good an Indian LCC will have it now."

40.title: We have a great chemistry: Kriti on working with Kartik in Shehzada
40.article_body: Speaking about working with actor Kartik Aaryan in 'Shehzada', actress Kriti Sanon said it has always been fun to work with him. She added they've great chemistry and their give and take as actors have always been...good. "So it's nice to reunite after Luka Chuppi," she said. Meanwhile, on the work front, Kriti was last seen in 'Bachchhan Paandey'.

41.title: Villagers spot Pakistani drone in Jammu and Kashmir
41.article_body: Villagers in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba district claimed to have spotted a Pakistani drone, a police official said. The drone was spotted in Rajpura area along the Indo-Pakistan international border, and the SOG Samba launched a search operation. The search operation used drones to scan but found nothing. This is the second drone sighting in Samba in last one month.

42.title: Who are the 5 new ministers in CM Bhagwant Mann's expanded Cabinet?
42.article_body: Five MLAs were sworn in as ministers in Punjab on Monday as Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann expanded his Cabinet for the first time after forming government in the state. The legislators who took oath are Aman Arora, Dr Inderbir Singh Nijjar, Fauja Singh Sarari, Chetan Singh Jouramajra and Anmol Gagan Mann. The Cabinet now has 15 ministers, including the CM.

43.title: US-headquartered unicorn startup Amagi aims to list in India: Co-founder
43.article_body: New York-headquartered Amagi, a media-tech software-as-a-service (SaaS) unicorn, is aiming to launch its initial public offering (IPO) in India, Co-founder Baskar Subramanian said in an episode of CNN-News18's Bits to Billions. With Amagi's profits growing more than two-fold in FY21, Subramanian said profitability is an addictive phenomenon. Further, he said that frugality helps with innovation.

44.title: Delhi govt installs CCTV cameras at critical water logging points
44.article_body: The Delhi government has installed CCTV cameras at critical water logging points in the city, with an aim of ensuring that they're monitored. According to PWD officials, there will be round-the-clock monitoring of the critical water logging points as the CCTV feed will be sent to the PWD control room from where instructions will be sent to the ground staff.

45.title: PMC receives over 4,000 objections against draft electoral roll
45.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation received 4,273 objections against the draft electoral roll published last month. It had published the draft electoral roll on June 23 and sought suggestions and objections of voters by July 1, which was later pushed to July 3. The PMC stated that only those registered till May 31 this year were included in the electoral roll.

46.title: Australia ends requirement to declare vaccination status for international arrivals
46.article_body: Australia will not require international arrivals to declare their COVID-19 vaccination status from Wednesday (July 6) onwards, the country's government has announced. The restrictions on international arrivals were introduced in 2020 to control the spread of COVID-19. They have been removed now to reduce delays at airports, Australian Home Affairs Minister Clare O'Neil said.

47.title: Alt News' Zubair taken to UP after new FIR over calling seers 'hate mongers'
47.article_body: Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair was brought to Uttar Pradesh's Sitapur by Delhi Police on Monday in connection with a new case registered against him for allegedly hurting religious sentiments. According to the FIR, Zubair had allegedly called Hindu seers Yati Narsinghanand Saraswati, Bajrang Muni, and Anand Swaroop "hate mongers" in his tweet dated May 27.

48.title: Pic shows 19-yr-old shooter Ankit posing with bullets spelling out 'Sidhu Moosewala'
48.article_body: A picture showing 19-year-old shooter Ankit Sirsa posing with bullets spelling out 'Sidhu Moosewala' before the singer was killed has surfaced online. Sirsa was arrested by Delhi Police over Moosewala's murder, with officers saying he was one of the shooters involved in the killing. Police said Sirsa was the "youngest shooter and most desperate" among those who shot Moosewala.

49.title: Madhubala begged Dilip Kumar to apologise to dad, he refused: Madhubala's sister
49.article_body: Madhubala's sister Madhur Bhushan said Madhubala and Dilip Kumar came close to tying the knot but it couldn't happen. "Had the court case not happened, Madhubala would've probably got married to Dilip Kumar. She...urged Dilip saab to apologise to our father," Madhu said. "[She asked him to] say...sorry for the sake of their relationship [but he] refused," she added.

50.title: RBI fines Kotak Mahindra Bank ₹1.05 cr, IndusInd Bank ₹1 cr for non-compliance
50.article_body: The RBI has imposed a monetary penalty of ₹1.05 crore on Kotak Mahindra Bank for not following its directions on customer protection and loans and advances. The bank also failed to credit eligible amount to Depositor Education and Awareness Fund within the prescribed period. Further, IndusInd Bank has been fined ₹1 crore for its failure to adhere to KYC rules.

51.title: Feeling Adivasi woman can't become Prez depicts 'nasty mindset': BJP
51.article_body: BJP National General Secretary CT Ravi on Monday criticised opposition candidate for Presidential polls, Yashwant Sinha, saying a feeling that an Adivasi woman is not capable of the position, depicts one's "nasty mindset". Murmu has already proved her capabilities, as the Governor of Jharkhand, as a minister and MLA in Odisha and as a lecturer in a college, he said.

52.title: Railways starts digital cloakrooms at KSR B'luru City & Cantt stations
52.article_body: The South Western Railway's Bengaluru division has started digital and smart cloakrooms at the KSR Bengaluru City and Bengaluru Cantonment railway stations. This project will generate non-fare revenue, officials said. "Passengers will be able to operate the lockers themselves using the KLOAK app and all operations including payments will be done online," an official stated.

53.title: Amit Shah spoke like broken gramophone at BJP event: T'gana minister
53.article_body: Telangana Finance Minister T Harish Rao on Monday said that Union Home Minister Amit Shah spoke like a "broken gramophone" at BJP's recently-held national executive meeting in Hyderabad. "[BJP leaders] spoke about nothing except getting into power...It was disappointing that they didn't talk about any new welfare development," Rao added. Assembly elections in Telangana will be held in 2023.

54.title: U'khand panel for Uniform Civil Code holds first meeting in Delhi
54.article_body: The first meeting of the five-member draft committee for implementing the Uniform Civil Code in Uttarakhand met for the first time after its formation in May in New Delhi on Monday. The meeting was held under the chairmanship of retired SC Judge Ranjana Desai, who iterated that the second meeting will be held after a week.

55.title: Lost 2 of my kids, thought everything was over: Maha CM as he breaks down in Assembly
55.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde broke down in the state Assembly while remembering his two children who died in a boat tragedy in 2000. He said he was working as a Shiv Sena Corporator in Thane back then. "I lost two of my children and thought everything is over...I was broken but Anand Dighe Sahab convinced me to continue," Shinde said.

56.title: Aditya Chopra to make 2-hero actioner with Salman, SRK: Report
56.article_body: Filmmaker Aditya Chopra is planning to make a two-hero action film featuring Salman Khan and Shah Rukh Khan, reported Pinkvilla. The report quoted a source saying this will be "the first proper two-hero collaboration for the two" since 1995 film 'Karan Arjun'. Salman and Shah Rukh will also be making cameos in each other's upcoming films 'Tiger 3' and 'Pathaan'.

57.title: The best I've ever seen in Tests: De Villiers on Pant-Jadeja's 222-run stand
57.article_body: Sharing his views on the ongoing fifth England-India Test, AB de Villiers said the "counterattack partnership" between Ravindra Jadeja and Rishabh Pant in the first innings is "the best" he has ever seen in Test cricket. Pant (146) and Jadeja (104) added a 222-run partnership for the sixth wicket. India scored 416 after being reduced to 98/5 at one stage.

58.title: IMD issues yellow alert for Delhi till Tuesday, orange alert for Wednesday
58.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a yellow alert for Delhi till Tuesday and an orange alert for the city on Wednesday, with forecasts of moderate to heavy rainfall. The IMD has said that precipitation will continue in the city over the next six days. The onset of monsoon in Delhi was declared on June 30.

59.title: Federer is my greatest rival and I personally miss him: Nadal
59.article_body: Rafael Nadal said playing Wimbledon without his greatest rival and eight-time champion Roger Federer is a "negative thing". He added, "I personally miss him on the tennis tour and tennis of course miss him, tournaments, fans, everyone." Federer is absent from this year's Championships through knee injury, the first time he has skipped the tournament in 23 years.

60.title: Hotels, restaurants barred from levying service charge automatically or by default
60.article_body: The Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has issued guidelines barring hotels and restaurants from levying service charge automatically or by default in bills. Consumers cannot be forced to pay service charge and hotels and restaurants shall clearly inform them that it's voluntary, the guidelines stated. Further, service charge cannot be collected from consumers by any other name.

61.title: Black balloons released near PM Modi's chopper in security scare in Andhra
61.article_body: Protestors released black balloons close to PM Narendra Modi's chopper in Andhra Pradesh on Monday in what is being deemed as a security breach. Police said three Congress workers have been taken into custody for releasing the balloons after the chopper took off from Gannavaram Airport, where a strict security cordon was set up around the airport.

62.title: BJP denies links with Lashkar terrorist after saying he was in Jammu unit's IT cell
62.article_body: J&K BJP chief Ravinder Raina has denied that the party had any links with captured Lashkar-e-Toiba terrorist Talib Hussain. This came after a BJP Minority Morcha order appointed Hussain as Jammu unit's IT and social media in-charge and the Minority Morcha chief confirmed his past association with BJP. "He doesn't have any membership in [party's] official records," said Raina.

63.title: Hyderabad Police arrest youth for harassing minor girl on Instagram
63.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police have arrested a 24-year-old man for stalking and sexually harassing a minor girl on Instagram. The accused, identified as Meka Prudhvi, reportedly created fake accounts on Instagram to approach women and coax them into sharing their private pictures, threatening to morph their images if they refused. The accused was booked under relevant sections of the POCSO Act.

64.title: History of freedom struggle not about a few years & some people: PM
64.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday said that the history of the freedom struggle of the country was not about a few years and some people, but about the sacrifice from every corner of India. In his address, after unveiling a 30-ft bronze statue of Alluri Sitarama Raju in Andhra Pradesh, the PM said, "We have not forgotten our freedom fighters."

65.title: Love from industry was hugely validating: Arjun on 'Ek...' transformation
65.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor has said that the outpouring of love he received from the industry after his physical transformation for 'Ek Villain Returns' was hugely validating. "I'm still a work in progress and I feel blessed to be a part of the industry that has held my hands when the going was tough emotionally," the actor added.

66.title: Drunk man from Haryana falls into Ganga in Haridwar, saved by water police
66.article_body: A drunk traveller from Haryana fell into Ganga river in Haridwar after he slipped while he was reportedly walking on the railing built on the banks of Ganga Ghat. He was saved by the City Patrol Unit and the water police, reports said. "The flow was high and he went with current but caught hold of another chain," police said.

67.title: Stray dog attacks 13 people, including 8 kids in Guj's Surat
67.article_body: A stray dog attacked thirteen people, including eight children below 10 years, in Gujarat's Surat on Monday. The kids approached a stray dog noticing strange behaviour, following which it bit them, according to reports. The dog then bit three women and two men before running away, reports added. The condition of all victims is normal, said hospital authorities.

68.title: Maharashtra will reduce VAT on fuel soon: CM Eknath Shinde
68.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Monday said the state will reduce VAT on fuel soon. While speaking in the Assembly, he said the decision will be taken by the state Cabinet. Shinde was replying to a debate after he won the floor test in the House. While 164 MLAs voted for the motion of confidence, 99 voted against it.

69.title: 6 men rob cash, jewellery worth ₹1 crore from Axis Bank branch in Rajasthan
69.article_body: At least six armed men allegedly barged into a branch of Axis Bank located in Bhiwadi town of Rajasthan's Alwar district and escaped with cash and gold worth ₹1 crore. Officials claimed the robbers, who were wearing masks, held the bank employees hostage. They robbed the bank in less than 30 minutes and then escaped on bikes, officials added.

70.title: Have high goals: 3rd seed Jabeur on reaching 2nd straight Wimbledon quarters
70.article_body: Third seed Ons Jabeur, the highest-remaining women's seed, reached her second straight Wimbledon quarter-final with a 7-6(11-9), 6-4 win over 24th seed Elise Mertens in fourth round on Sunday. Following her win, the Tunisian said she has "very high" goals for the tournament. It was Jabeur's ninth straight win on grass, which includes winning a title in Berlin last month.

71.title: 2 BJP MPs booked in Chhattisgarh for sharing fake video of Rahul
71.article_body: BJP MPs Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore and Subrat Pathak were booked in Chhattisgarh for allegedly sharing a fake video of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi. "Original video was...Rahul's...comment on...SFI violence on his Wayanad office but it was...doctored to appear as if it was a comment on...Udaipur [murder]," Congress' Jairam Ramesh said. FIRs against the MPs have also been filed in other states.

72.title: ITC shares hit 52-week high, surge nearly 34% in a year
72.article_body: Shares of ITC hit a fresh 52-week high on Monday to close at ₹291.80 apiece, up by nearly 2% from its previous close of ₹284. The stock also hit an intraday high of ₹293.30 on the BSE on Monday. While the stock closed at ₹218 on December 31, its shares have gained nearly 34% this year.

73.title: Just quoted what was said in West: Resul after getting criticised for RRR tweet
73.article_body: Oscar-winning sound designer Resul Pookutty has responded after getting criticised for calling 'RRR' a "gay love story" on social media. In a tweet, he also said Alia Bhatt was used as a prop in the film. Replying to a user who tweeted, "You've lost respect today for demeaning...RRR", Resul wrote, "That's what they called it in...west, I merely quoted it."

74.title: Anupam Kher reacts to post about man carrying blind mother on his shoulder
74.article_body: Anupam Kher reacted to a viral post in which a man reportedly named Kailash Giri, is carrying his blind mother to several pilgrimages on his shoulder. Anupam wrote, "If anybody can find the whereabouts of this man please...let us know...@anupamcares will be honoured to sponsor all his journeys with his mother to any pilgrimage in the country all his life."

75.title: SL Tests can help develop our batters for big series in India in 2023: Pat
75.article_body: Australia Test captain Pat Cummins said the ongoing Test series in Sri Lanka can "help develop and fast track batters" for the "big series" in India next year. "If you want to be the number one Test team in the world you've got to be winning overseas," he added. Australia have not won a Test series in India since 2004/05.

76.title: BJP could’ve made Scindia CM, Shivraj Chouhan Deputy CM: Digvijaya
76.article_body: Following the political development in Maharashtra, Congress’ Digvijaya Singh said the BJP does "great injustice". "After Eknath Shinde revolted, he was made Chief Minister and Devendra Fadnavis, Deputy Chief Minister. In Madhya Pradesh, too, they could’ve made Scindia Chief Minister and Shivraj Singh Chouhan, Deputy Chief Minister," Singh tweeted. "This is sheer hypocrisy," he added.

77.title: 5-yr-old dies after falling off 'pithoo' during Kedarnath pilgrimage
77.article_body: A five-year-old boy who was travelling with his family to Uttarakhand's Kedarnath shrine died after falling off his pithoo into a deep gorge, the police said. An FIR has been registered against an unidentified labourer from Nepal for causing the boy's death because of negligence, officers said, adding that the man is on the run.

78.title: Bairstow had one of few technical errors, now discovered himself: Watson
78.article_body: Former Australian cricketer Shane Watson has said that English batter Jonny Bairstow has now "discovered" himself across all formats. "...[Earlier] there were one of the few technical deficiencies that Bairstow had...Now he's really discovered," Watson said. "Bairstow just discovered the format that worked for him in the shorter format...[and] in Tests...he has found that formula," Watson added.

79.title: MP tribal woman hides in man's home; beaten, made to carry husband on shoulders
79.article_body: A 30-year-old tribal woman was allegedly thrashed and was forced to carry her husband on her shoulders in Madhya Pradesh on Sunday. Police said that the woman had gone missing a week ago and her husband recently came to know that she was hiding in a house of a man, who is reportedly her close friend.

80.title: Varanasi court adjourns hearing in Gyanvapi mosque case till July 12
80.article_body: The district court in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi has adjourned the hearing in the Gyanvapi mosque case till July 12. The Muslim side will keep its arguments on law point in front of the court then, said Advocate Vishnu Jain, who is representing the Hindu side. He added that the Muslim side has given its arguments.

81.title: I'm a married woman now: Deepika to fan saying 'We love you'
81.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone recently attended Konkani Sammelan as the chief guest in California. A video which is going viral on social media shows a fan shouting, "We love you, Deepika" while the actress was on stage. She responded from the stage, "I'm a married woman now, behave yourselves." She also attended Shankar Mahadevan's concert with husband Ranveer Singh in US.

82.title: Biker misbehaves with women cyclists in Bengaluru; manhunt launched
82.article_body: The police said on Monday that a manhunt has been launched for a biker who has been misbehaving with women cyclists in Bengaluru. The women cyclists, who have filed separate complaints, have not been able to identify the biker or note the bike's registration number. According to the police, the biker is believed to be a food delivery boy.

83.title: Pretty sure we'll be able to have dinner together: Bairstow on his spat with Kohli
83.article_body: Referring to his spat with Virat Kohli during Day 3 of the fifth Test, Jonny Bairstow said, "There was nothing." He added, "We've been fortunate to play against each other for ten years. So...I’m pretty sure we’ll be able to have dinner [together]." Bairstow stated, "We're playing Test cricket and we're two competitors. It brings the best out of us."

84.title: Pant breaks Dhoni's record, scores most runs in a Test in England by an India keeper
84.article_body: Rishabh Pant has set the record for scoring most runs in a Test in England by an India wicketkeeper. The 24-year-old scored 203 runs (146 in the first innings and 57 in the second innings) in the rescheduled fifth Test at Edgbaston to create the record. The previous record of 151 runs was set by MS Dhoni in 2011.

85.title: Data of 1 bn Chinese citizens allegedly stolen, hacker offers to sell it for ₹1.58 cr
85.article_body: A hacker has claimed to have stolen one billion Chinese citizens' data after breaching a Shanghai police database, in what's being called one of the biggest data breaches ever. The hacker has offered to sell over 23 TB of data for 10 Bitcoin worth about ₹1.58 crore. It includes names, addresses, birthplaces, national IDs, phone numbers and criminal case information.

86.title: Pic of PM Modi touching feet of freedom fighter's daughter released
86.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday met the family of Pasala Krishna Murthy, who was a freedom fighter from Andhra Pradesh. The government shared a picture of PM Modi touching the feet of the freedom fighter's daughter Pasala Krishna Bharathi. "She's 90 years old and she blessed the PM, [he] also met her sister and niece," the government said.

87.title: Actor Vishal suffers leg injury during 'Laththi' shoot months after hand injury
87.article_body: Actor Vishal suffered an injury on his leg while filming the climax of his upcoming Tamil film 'Laththi'. This is the second time that Vishal has suffered an injury on the sets of the film. In February, Vishal suffered multiple hairline fractures on his hand and finger while shooting an action sequence for the film.

88.title: He nullified drive, scored 241: Vaughan wants Zak to go Tendulkar way
88.article_body: Former England skipper Michael Vaughan has said that English opener Zak Crawley should do what former India batter Sachin Tendulkar did to tackle seam bowling. "Tendulkar had a tough tour to Australia in 2004...he was getting out playing the drive. What did he do? He nullified the drive...scored 241 in Sydney. Crawley has not tried that yet," Vaughan said.

89.title: Who benefitted from Kanhaiya Lal’s murder? BJP: Mehbooba Mufti
89.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti said BJP provides support and patronage to criminal elements and uses them for their benefit and propaganda. "When Kanhaiya Lal was murdered (in Udaipur), Hindus and Muslims went against each other. Who benefitted? BJP," Mufti added. "Questions are raised on Pulwama attack…How did the attack take place? Who benefitted from it? BJP," she stated.

90.title: Woman ends life by jumping in front of Jor Bagh metro, service disrupted
90.article_body: A woman died by suicide by jumping in front of a moving train at Delhi metro's Jor Bagh metro station, according to the police. The incident caused a temporary disruption of service on a part of the Yellow Line corridor. There was no suicide note found on her, because of which the reason behind the extreme step remains unknown.

91.title: 4-year-old girl raped in Delhi, neighbour held
91.article_body: A man was held by the Delhi Police for allegedly raping a four-year-old girl in North East Delhi. Police received information about the incident on Sunday night and alleged that the accused misbehaved with the girl after he saw her alone. Both families live in the same building and are involved in labour work, police said.

92.title: NCP's Ajit Pawar to be Leader of Opposition in Maharashtra Assembly
92.article_body: Former Maharashtra Deputy CM and NCP leader Ajit Pawar will be the new Leader of Opposition in the state Assembly. As per reports, the decision was proposed by NCP Legislative party leader Jayant Patil and approved by the Assembly. Earlier on Monday, CM Eknath Shinde-led Maharashtra government passed the floor test after surpassing the majority mark of 144.

93.title: Sehwag criticised for his 'Chamiya naach rahi hai' remark on Kohli's celebratory dance
93.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has been criticised over his 'Chamiya naach rahi hai' remark on Virat Kohli's celebratory dance during the third day of the rescheduled India-England fifth Test at Edgbaston. "Disgraceful! Inappropriate for game of cricket," a fan commented. "Sehwag used a slur that's offensive," another wrote. Another tweet read, "Sehwag is absolutely horrendous when commentating."

94.title: Ranveer to replace Karan Johar as 'Bigg Boss OTT 2' host: Reports
94.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh will replace filmmaker Karan Johar as the host of the upcoming season of 'Bigg Boss OTT', according to reports. "Makers have started working on the second season of Bigg Boss OTT. As they couldn't get dates from Karan Johar, the makers have finalised Ranveer Singh to host the show," reports stated.

95.title: Sushmita starrer Aarya to return with season 3: Director Ram Madhvani
95.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen's show 'Aarya' is all set to return with season 3. Director Ram Madhvani took to social media to share the update. Alongside the post, he wrote, "Aarya Season 3 in Development. Creator @madhvaniram, @sushmitasen47, @disneyplushotstar and @endemolshineind collaborate once again to escalate the excitement." The post has a video clip capturing the high points of season 2.

96.title: Had tears as it was my dream to score a Ranji ton for Mumbai: Sarfaraz
96.article_body: Mumbai batter Sarfaraz Khan revealed that he had "tears" in his eyes when he was leaving Mumbai to play for Uttar Pradesh in 2015/16. "I had tears in my eyes as it was my dream to score a Ranji Trophy hundred in Mumbai clothes," Sarfaraz said. Notably, the 24-year-old cricketer made a comeback to the Mumbai side in 2019/20.

97.title: Reports stating Cong likely to pull out of MVA alliance are false: HK Patil
97.article_body: Following the political development in state, Maharashtra Congress in-charge HK Patil on Monday said the MVA alliance is stable. “I saw some reports stating Congress is likely to pull out of the MVA alliance in Maharashtra. They are false,” Patil added. “Congress has neither discussed this nor decided on anything. The rumours are far away from the truth,” he stated.

98.title: Declared 'persona non grata', Russian diplomats leave Bulgaria
98.article_body: Many Russian diplomats, along with their families, left Bulgaria in two airplanes on Sunday after they were declared "persona non grata". Before leaving, a diplomat said he was among the 70 Russian staff, who were ordered to leave the country. The mass expulsion decision was announced by Bulgaria's acting Prime Minister Kiril Petkov.

99.title: Will provide free electricity upto 300 units in Gujarat if elected: Kejriwal
99.article_body: AAP National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal said that his party will make electricity free upto 300 units in Gujarat just like it did in Punjab, if voted to power. "In Gujarat, ministers are enjoying because their electricity bill comes to zero despite consuming thousands of units but a poor has to pay thousands for just a fan and bulb," he said.

100.title: Bharat Gogawale gives petition to suspend 16 MLAs of Uddhav Thackeray faction
100.article_body: The chief whip of Shiv Sena's Eknath Shinde faction, Bharat Gogawale, has given a petition to Maharashtra Assembly Speaker for suspension of 16 MLAs of the Uddhav Thackeray faction. News agency ANI said the Speaker's office has confirmed that the notice will be issued to 16 MLAs of Shiv Sena for the violation of whip.

101.title: UP can lead country ahead: CM Yogi on completing 100 days of 2nd term
101.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday said that his government has worked to change UP’s image of "hooliganism and crime", with foreign investment subsequently rising. "UP is the biggest state in the country and can lead the country ahead," CM Yogi added. His statement came on the completion of 100 days of his government's second term.

102.title: Teacher caught on camera slapping, beating 5-yr-old with stick in Bihar; boy faints
102.article_body: A video of a Patna tuition teacher slapping and beating a five-year-old boy with a stick is being widely circulated online. The teacher could be seen using a stick to beat the kid until it breaks, with reports claiming that the boy lost consciousness after the beating. IAS officer Awanish Sharan said an FIR has been filed against the teacher.

103.title: Tiger and I both have a soft corner for each other: Kriti Sanon
103.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon spoke about reuniting with Tiger Shroff in 'Ganapath Part 1', saying that the two have a soft corner for each other. Kriti and Tiger made their debut together in the 2014 film 'Heropanti'. "We were like babies and we both have grown as people and also as actors...I think we have great chemistry," the actress added.

104.title: Punjab man 'sold' in search of job jailed in N Macedonia for 5 yrs
104.article_body: A man from Punjab's Nawanshahr is serving five-year jail term in North Macedonia after he was nabbed there without his passport. The man, Balvir Ram, who wanted to travel to Greece to seek employment, was allegedly "sold" by a travel agent to some Pakistani agents in Serbia. Those agents then allegedly trafficked Ram to North Macedonia and confiscated his passport.

105.title: Class 12 boy kills teacher in UP, wanted to get out of relationship with her; arrested
105.article_body: A student of class 12 was arrested by Uttar Pradesh Police in Ayodhya for allegedly murdering his teacher. "The arrested boy was in a relationship with the victim teacher. He wanted to get out of the relationship as he was scared of getting exposed," police said. "The teacher used to threaten him of making insulting revelations about him," police added.

106.title: I thank him for giving us such a film: Rajinikanth praises Madhavan's Rocketry
106.article_body: Veteran actor Rajinikanth has penned a note praising R Madhavan's film 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect'. He said that everyone should watch the film, especially the youngsters. "In his (Madhavan) very first film, he has proved that he is on par with other great filmmakers," Rajinikanth wrote, adding, "I thank him for giving us such a film. Congratulations."

107.title: PM secures future of friends abroad, leaves youth here jobless: Rahul
107.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday alleged that PM Narendra Modi secures futures of friends abroad, but leaves the youth of India unemployed. Rahul also shared a video of young men who had taken the exam for recruitment as police personnel in the Central paramilitary forces walking on the streets in protest because they never got the results.

108.title: B'luru citizens' group calls for bandh on July 12 over Eidgah ground issue
108.article_body: The Chamarajpet Citizens' Federation, which comprises several trader organisations and right-wing Hindu outfits, called for a bandh on July 12 in Bengaluru over the Eidgah ground ownership issue. The citizens' group stated that the ground is for the public and not a Wakf Board property. It had reportedly planned to launch a door-to-door campaign over the issue.

109.title: Anshula shares video writing 'No Bra Club', Priyanka comments 'Everyday'
109.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor's sister Anshula Kapoor shared a video on Instagram in which she removes her bra from under her dress, writing, "The best part about coming home from Sunday brunch! #NoBraClub." Actress Priyanka Chopra reacted to Anshula's post, commenting, "Everyday" with a laughing emoji. Another social media user commented, "During the pandemic every day was Sunday."

110.title: Taapsee Pannu to produce a film starring Samantha Ruth Prabhu
110.article_body: Taapsee Pannu is all set to produce a film starring Samantha Ruth Prabhu. "There's something that we're working together on. We will announce what it is very soon," Taapsee, who will next be seen in 'Shabaash Mithu', said. Taapsee is also producing a film titled, 'Dhak Dhak', which stars Ratna Pathak Shah, Fatima Sana Shaikh, Dia Mirza and Sanjana Sanghi.

111.title: Bairstow was batting carefully; got pumped after Kohli's sledge: Jaffer
111.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said that he feels that English batter Jonny Bairstow got "pumped" after being sledged by India's Virat Kohli at the Edgbaston Test on Sunday. "Yes...because before that [sledging] he [Bairstow] was batting very carefully. But when you instigate someone, it backfires sometimes. So maybe Bairstow got pumped up after that sledge," Jaffer said.

112.title: Her last post was for SSR, she wanted to talk about him: Saroj Khan's daughter
112.article_body: Saroj Khan's daughter Sukaina recalled the late choreographer told her to write a post for Sushant Singh Rajput after his death. "[Mom] enjoyed social media a lot. She used to...say, 'Even I'd like to post something,"' Sukaina said. "The last post...was for Sushant. She told me, 'Please write down a post, I want to talk about that boy,'" Sukaina added.

113.title: Australian PM visits Ukraine, pledges additional aid worth ₹540 cr
113.article_body: Australian PM Anthony Albanese has pledged additional military and technical aid worth about A$100 million (over ₹540 crore) following his visit to Kyiv. The package includes 14 armoured personnel carriers and 20 Bushmaster protected mobility vehicles, among others. Albanese also said that Australia will ban Russian gold imports and sanction 16 more of the latter country's ministers and oligarchs.

114.title: 4 arrested for killing 53-yr-old property dealer in Pune 11 months ago
114.article_body: Four men have been arrested for allegedly killing a 53-year-old property dealer in Pune district in August 2021. The victim was found strangled to death with her limbs tied and mouth taped at her house in Chikhali. The woman wore a lot of gold ornaments and the suspects targeted her to rob her of the valuables and cash, police said.

115.title: Delhi Assembly passes bills to hike salaries of its members by 66%
115.article_body: The Delhi Assembly on Monday passed bills proposing 66.67% hike in salaries and allowances of its members. "For Delhi MLAs, salary and allowances are being increased from ₹54,000 per month to ₹90,000," Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said. "To invite talented people into politics, there has to be rewards," he added. The bills will be sent to the President for approval.

116.title: Complaint filed against 'Kaali' director Leena for poster of goddess smoking cigarette
116.article_body: A police complaint has been filed against Leena Manimekalai, the director of the documentary 'Kaali', over a poster showing a woman dressed as the Hindu goddess smoking a cigarette. The complaint has been filed by a lawyer from Delhi. Calling the poster "highly objectionable", the lawyer sought a ban on the picture and relevant clip of the documentary.

117.title: Shinde faction cannot claim to be original Shiv Sena: Sanjay Raut
117.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said that the faction led by Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde cannot claim to be original Shiv Sena. The "Thackeray name is synonymous with Shiv Sena," the Rajya Sabha member said. "They used the party symbol and all benefits that come along with it to win election, and then broke the same party," Raut further said.

118.title: Decisions taken in MVA govt's last cabinet meet will be upheld: Fadnavis
118.article_body: The newly-formed Maharashtra government, led by CM Eknath Shinde, will uphold the previous government's decision to rename Aurangabad and Osmanabad, as well as the upcoming Navi Mumbai International Airport, deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis announced on Monday. "We will take a cabinet meet and reaffirm the renaming of cities decided by the last cabinet meet of the previous government," he added.

119.title: A cricket-loving nation should love women's team equally: Taapsee
119.article_body: Taapsee Pannu, who'll play the role of former Indian women’s cricket team captain, Mithali Raj in the biopic 'Shabaash Mithu', said in our country there are two religions, cricket and films. "If you call yourself a cricket-loving nation then you should love women’s cricket equally, you're not just men’s cricket-loving nation," she said. "Cricket should matter and not...gender," Taapsee added.

120.title: Putin will not congratulate Biden on US Independence Day: Russia
120.article_body: Russia said that President Vladimir Putin will not congratulate his American counterpart Joe Biden on the US' Independence Day on July 4. "Congratulations this year can hardly be considered appropriate," said Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov. "The United States' unfriendly policies are the reason," he added. The statement comes amid tensions between the two countries owing to the Ukraine war.

121.title: Had once said that I'll come back, several people mocked me: Fadnavis
121.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Monday said, "I had once said that I'll come back but when I said that, several people mocked me." "I've come back today and brought him (Eknath Shinde) along with me. I won't take revenge on people who mocked me. I'll forgive them. Everything isn't taken to heart in politics,"  Fadnavis added.

122.title: Plant presumed extinct rediscovered after 188 years in Himachal Pradesh
122.article_body: A plant species, Brachystelma attenuatum, which scientists had presumed extinct has been rediscovered in Himachal Pradesh's Hamirpur and Mandi districts after 188 years. It was identified by researchers from Botanical Survey of India, Dehradun and Himachal Pradesh University, Shimla. Its last record dates back to 1835 when British botanists John Royle and Robert Wight found the plant in Himachal.

123.title: Kind of see a little bit of myself in his game: Djokovic on facing Sinner
123.article_body: Talking about facing his quarter-final opponent Jannik Sinner at Wimbledon, top seed Novak Djokovic said the 20-year-old Italian is very solid and is maturing a lot on the big stage. "I kind of see a little bit of myself in his game, as well, from back of the court, playing flat backhands, constantly staying on...back of the line," he added.

124.title: Hyd civic body levies fines on BJP & TRS for unauthorised banners
124.article_body: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has levied fines on TRS and BJP for hosting unauthorised banners, posters and signboards. GHMC reportedly fined BJP of approximately ₹20 lakh while it levied fine of up to ₹3 lakh on TRS, stating that the amount may increase if banners stay up. Political posters, including some inspired by 'Money Heist', surfaced across Hyderabad recently.

125.title: Shankar sings happy birthday to Ranveer at US concert, videos viral
125.article_body: Ranveer Singh and Deepika Padukone attended Shankar Mahadevan's concert in US' California where Shankar sang happy birthday to Ranveer. Ranveer will celebrate his 37th birthday on Wednesday. Videos from the concert have gone viral. One of them shows Ranveer onstage, saying, "I was given strict instructions to not do this...[My mother-in-law] is sitting in...front row wagging her finger at me."

126.title: Payments to Aakash are closed: BYJU'S amid reports of delay in $1 billion deal
126.article_body: India's most valuable edtech startup BYJU'S said that its payments to Aakash Educational Services are closed after reports emerged that it is pushing back payments. In 2021, BYJU'S struck a deal to acquire Aakash, which runs a chain of physical coaching centres, in a cash-and-stock deal worth $1 billion. "All payments are expected to be completed by...August," BYJU'S earlier said.

127.title: Padma Shri recipient director Tarun Majumdar passes away aged 91
127.article_body: Padma Shri recipient director Tarun Majumdar passed away aged 91 on Monday. He was on ventilator support and undergoing treatment for age-related ailments at the state-run hospital SSKM in Kolkata. He won the National Award four times for his films 'Kancher Swarga', 'Nimantran', 'Ganadevata' and 'Aranya Amar'. He also received five Filmfare Awards including the Lifetime Achievement Award in 2021.

128.title: 22 MLAs remained absent during Maharashtra floor test process
128.article_body: A total of 22 MLAs remained absent during the process of floor test in Maharashtra Assembly on Monday. The list of absent MLAs includes 10 Congress MLAs - Jitesh Antapurkar, Zeeshan Siddique, Praniti Shinde, Ashok Chavan, Vijay Wadettiwar, Dhiraj Deshmukh, Kunal Patil, Raju Awale, Mohanrao Hambarde and Shirish Chaudhari. Eknath Shinde won the floor test with 164-99 margin.

129.title: 7 get stuck in elevator of 7-storey Thane building, rescued after 30 mins
129.article_body: Seven people got stuck in an elevator of a seven-storey building in Thane on Monday, a civic official said. Local fire officials rushed to the spot after getting information, the official added. The firemen managed to open the lift and rescued the people, who were stuck in it for about half-an-hour.

130.title: Himachal CM visits Kullu where 12, including students, died in accident
130.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jairam Thakur visited the Kullu district where at least 12 people, including school children, were killed and dozen injured after a bus fell into a gorge on Monday. The private bus was on its way to Sainj from Kullu. The Chief Minister has announced ₹5 lakh for the family members of those killed in the accident.

131.title: Which are the best performing states in providing startup ecosystem as per Govt rankings?
131.article_body: The third edition of the State's Startup Ranking of 2021 was released on Monday. For the category of best performers in developing a startup ecosystem, Gujarat emerged as the best performer for the third consecutive year, along with Karnataka. Meghalaya has topped the list of small states. A total of 24 states and seven Union Territories participated in this.

132.title: 10,000 became unemployed; 200 died in Char Dham: Rawat on BJP govt's 100 days
132.article_body: Former Uttarakhand CM Harish Rawat has commented on the completion of 100 days of the BJP-run Uttarakhand government. "In the last 100 days, at least 10,000 youths have joined the list of the unemployed. Over 200 persons died during the Char Dham Yatra [this year]," Rawat said. The Congress leader added that the Centre's Agnipath scheme is a "fraud".

133.title: Judicial verdicts can't be reflection of influence of public opinion: SC judge
133.article_body: Supreme Court judge Justice JB Pardiwala said Judicial verdicts cannot be the reflection of the influence of public opinion. Justice Pardiwala along with Justice Surya Kant heard Nupur Sharma’s plea. "A judicial verdict, right or wrong, is always by a court vested with the powers under the Constitution of India as a court of record," Justice Pardiwala added.

134.title: 20-yr-old man killed with key after argument over vehicles touching in Delhi
134.article_body: A 20-year-old man was stabbed to death with a key after getting into an argument with another person over their vehicles touching on Delhi road. Reports said that the deceased and his friend were returning after purchasing liquor when person they had an argument with returned with his associate. The deceased was then struck in the chest with a key.

135.title: US study claims new COVID-19 test can detect all variants in hours
135.article_body: Researchers at a university in the US claimed to have developed a new COVID-19 test that can detect all current variants of SARS-CoV-2 accurately within hours. The test, called CoVarScan, can identify signatures of eight hotspots on the SARS-CoV-2 virus. The study, published in the Clinical Chemistry journal, was based on samples collected from over 4,000 patients.

136.title: Bumrah is that rare beast of international cricket, a fast-bowling captain: Lloyd
136.article_body:
Ex-England player David Lloyd has praised India's stand-in captain Jasprit Bumrah, stating that the 28-year-old belongs to "rare beasts of international cricket", the fast-bowling captains. Lloyd added, 
"Bumrah is high-quality and must be so awkward to face...the batsman doesn't get a clear view of the ball due to the quirkiness of his action...He takes his wickets at spit."

137.title: Gunman acted alone, no terror link: Police on Copenhagen shooting
137.article_body: The Danish Police on Monday said that the Copenhagen mall shooting, which left three people dead, was not related to terrorism. The police said the 22-year-old suspect acted alone and chose his victims at random. The police did not discuss the motive behind the killing but said, "Our suspect is also known among psychiatric services."

138.title: NCW seeks action against Akhilesh Yadav for his tweet against Nupur Sharma
138.article_body: National Commission for Women's Chairperson Rekha Sharma has written to Uttar Pradesh DGP to take immediate action against former CM Akhilesh Yadav for his tweet against suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma. After the Supreme Court said that Sharma should apologise for her remarks against Prophet Muhammad, Yadav tweeted, "Not only the face, but the body should also apologise."

139.title: 1st look of Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air's crew uniform with sneakers released
139.article_body: Billionaire and ace investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air has released the first look of its crew uniform comprising orange jackets, black trousers and sneakers. The airline said it's the first to introduce such a uniform for the in-flight crew. The uniforms are made using recycled polyester fabric made from pet bottle plastics salvaged from marine waste, said Akasa.

140.title: Late actor Sushant Singh Rajput's ex-flatmate Siddharth Pithani granted bail in drugs case
140.article_body: The Bombay High Court on Monday granted bail to late actor Sushant Singh Rajput's former flatmate Siddharth Pithani in a drugs case linked to Sushant's death. He was arrested by the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) from Hyderabad in May 2021. In the bail plea, his lawyer claimed that there was no evidence of Pithani's involvement in illicit drug trafficking.

141.title: India U-17 women's football team's assistant coach Ambrose sacked for sexual misconduct
141.article_body: India Under-17 women's football team's assistant coach Alex Ambrose has been sacked for alleged sexual misconduct, SY Quraishi, a member of the Supreme Court-appointed Committee of Administrators (CoA) overseeing the All India Football Federation (AIFF) said. The 39-year-old was earlier told to return to India midway through the team's preparation tour to Italy and Norway.

142.title: India needs fewer GST slabs, but 28% rate will remain: Revenue Secretary
142.article_body: Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj said the government aims to simplify the GST by consolidating the lower tax slabs. "India needs fewer slabs. 28% slab will remain, but whether 5%, 12%, and 18% rates can be simplified is yet to be seen," he explained. The government is aiming for stability in GST in the next one or two years, Bajaj added.

143.title: Didn't want to step out after 'Tees Maar...', mom-in-law encouraged me: Farah
143.article_body: Choreographer-director Farah Khan recalled how her film 'Tees Maar Khan' was "ripped apart" by people and said, "After Tees Maar Khan, I didn't want to step out, even though I was winning...award for...choreography of Sheila Ki Jawani." "My mother-in-law encouraged me to go for it," she added. "So, through time and...ups and downs, I grew older and wiser," said Farah.

144.title: Thousands recite Hanuman Chalisa in Jaipur in protest over tailor's murder
144.article_body: Thousands of people recited the Hanuman Chalisa on roads in Jaipur, following a silent procession organised by the "Sarva Hindu Samaj", in a protest over the beheading of a tailor in Udaipur on Sunday. Members of the VHP, RSS along with other Hindu organisations participated in the protest. A police official said that the protest was held peacefully.

145.title: Over 16,000 prospective parents waiting to adopt a child for past 3 years: Data
145.article_body: According to Central Adoption Resource Authority's (CARA) data, 16,155 prospective parents whose home study reports have been approved three years ago are still waiting for adoption. The officials of CARA attributed the slowdown to availability of fewer children who are legally free for adoption. As per the data on June 28, there are 3,596 children legally free for adoption.

146.title: India gifts 75 ambulances, 17 school buses to Nepali organisations
146.article_body: India has gifted 75 ambulances and 17 school buses to beneficiary organisations of Nepal on Sunday, the Embassy of India in Kathmandu tweeted. Indian Ambassador to Nepal Naveen Srivastava handed over the keys in the presence of Nepali minister Devendra Paudel. Srivastava highlighted that the gift "is part of a very robust and long-standing partnership between India and Nepal."

147.title: A 257-run lead is a long way now for England to chase: Vaughan
147.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said India's 257-run lead at the end of Day 3 in the ongoing Test is a "long way" for the Ben Stokes-led side to chase down. "India get another 150 and it's 400," he added. "A few of [England's] old traits have returned when...facing real quality. I see nothing but an India win," Vaughan further said.

148.title: Reports say Hrithik refused to shoot 'Vikram Vedha' in UP, makers clarify
148.article_body: Reliance Entertainment has reacted to reports claiming that the budget of 'Vikram Vedha' doubled after Hrithik Roshan refused to shoot in Uttar Pradesh and asked the makers to build a set depicting UP in Dubai. Calling the reports "misleading", Reliance Entertainment said, "We clearly want to state that Vikram Vedha has been shot extensively in India, including Lucknow."

149.title: Traffic movement to be slow in Mumbai's several places at 3:30 pm today
149.article_body: The Mumbai Traffic Police has announced that the vehicular movement around a few areas of Mumbai will be slowed down at 3:30 pm on Monday due to a planned VIP movement. "Traffic movement will be slow around Vidhan Bhavan, Haji Ali, Chaityabhoomi, Sea link, Bandra Kurla Complex connector, Eastern Express Highway, Anand Nagar toll plaza," the Mumbai Traffic Police tweeted.

150.title: Sania Mirza advances to QF of mixed doubles event at Wimbledon
150.article_body: India's Sania Mirza and her Croatian partner Mate Pavic have entered the quarter-finals of the mixed doubles event at Wimbledon on Sunday. The sixth-seeded pair reached the quarter-finals after their second-round opponents Ivan Dodig and Latisha Chan gave them a walkover. Notably, the duo will face the Australian-Canadian pair of John Peers and Gabriela Dabrowski in the quarter-finals on Monday.

151.title: We'll go to villages, find other workers: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut
151.article_body: Following the political development in Maharashtra, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Monday said the party won’t weaken. "Our oxygen isn’t power…This (BJP and Eknath Shinde faction alliance) is a temporary arrangement," Raut added. "People come and go. They opted to join our party and left due to outside forces. We'll go to villages...find other workers," he stated.

152.title: Attempt to shut our critical work: Alt News rejects claims of receiving foreign funds
152.article_body: Fact-checking website Alt News on Monday issued a statement rejecting Delhi Police’s claims that its Co-founder Mohammed Zubair, Director of Pravda Media, received donations from Pakistan and Syria. It said, "Our payment platform through which we receive donations does not allow...funds from foreign sources...All of this is an attempt to shut down the very critical work that we do."

153.title: Oscar winner Pookutty calls RRR a 'gay love story', says Alia was used as prop in it
153.article_body: Oscar-winning film sound designer Resul Pookutty called RRR a 'gay love story' and tweeted that Alia Bhatt was used as a prop in the film. Reacting to his remarks, a Twitter user wrote, "Time and again people prove that no awards, position, rewards, money, fame have nothing to do with intelligence!" Another wrote, "Is that jealousy that is speaking?"

154.title: Vauld suspends trading, deposits & withdrawals citing 'financial difficulties'
154.article_body: Singapore-based cryptocurrency exchange Vauld has suspended all trading, withdrawals, and deposits on its platform. CEO Darshan Bathija said that the decision has been taken due to "volatile market conditions" and "financial difficulties" that its business partners are facing and is impacting them too. Founded in 2018, while Vauld is based in Singapore, most of its workforce is based in India.

155.title: Would've sat at home had the BJP told me to: Maha Deputy CM Fadnavis
155.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said he would have sat at home if Bharatiya Janata Party had told him to do so. "[It is] same party that made me Chief Minister...Today I tell you that there will never be a tussle for power in this govt...People taunt...it's an ED government...it's an ED government, government of Eknath Devendra," he added.

156.title: Conditions will vary a lot from venue to venue: Vettori on touring India
156.article_body: Australia's assistant coach Daniel Vettori has said that they will face challenges during their Indian tour as conditions will vary a lot from venue to venue. "Conditions will be very different...You could get anything in between [the pitches in Pakistan and Sri Lanka]. In Mohali, it will be flat, if you play at Wankhede, it could turn square," Vettori said.

157.title: Will take action as a dictator to tackle malpractices: Tamil Nadu CM
157.article_body: Addressing a party meeting of urban local body representatives, Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin said that people close to him say that he is acting in a "very democratic way" but anyone doing anything isn't democratic. "I'll take action as a dictator if malpractices arise. This isn't only for local body representatives but for all," he added.

158.title: Film poster shows goddess Kali smoking, director accused of hurting religious sentiments
158.article_body: Director Leena Manimekalai shared poster of her recent documentary, wherein goddess Kali is shown smoking. Several social media users accused Leena of hurting religious sentiments. "How can this be allowed to...release on digital platforms?" a user tweeted. Major Surendra Poonia wrote, "Madam, you...murdered...whole idea of respecting faith of 100 crore Hindus by showing goddess Kali as smoker."

159.title: Man run over by tempo after he falls asleep under it, dies in Pune
159.article_body: A 35-year-old man who was run over by a tempo after he fell asleep under the vehicle in Pune's Mangalwar Peth, has succumbed to his injuries. The deceased was apparently under the influence of alcohol and fell asleep under the tempo while taking shelter from the rain when the incident occurred. A case has been registered in the matter.

160.title: Hoarding with KCR's questions to PM Modi put up in Hyderabad
160.article_body: A hoarding showing Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao's questions to PM Narendra Modi was put up at Diamond Point Road near Parade Ground in Hyderabad. With a hashtag #ModiMustAnswer, KCR was shown questioning the PM on death of farmers during farm law protests and that of migrants during lockdown, promise to bring black money and privatisation of PSUs.

161.title: 19-year-old shooter Ankit arrested for Sidhu Moosewala's murder in Delhi
161.article_body: Delhi Police have arrested 19-year-old shooter Ankit along with his associate in Sidhu Moosewala murder case. Officers said Ankit is one of the shooters involved in Moosewala's murder and the other accused, Sachin, was responsible for harbouring four of the shooters after the killing. Police recovered two pistols, 19 live cartridges and three uniforms of Punjab Police from them.

162.title: He got a good delivery, that's how I'd describe it: Zaheer on Kohli's wicket
162.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli's dismissal during India's second innings in the ongoing Test against England, ex-India pacer Zaheer Khan said the ex-India captain "couldn't do much" on the delivery. "Kohli got a good delivery. That's how I would describe his dismissal...If a bowler gets you out with a good ball, what kind of analysis can you do?" stated Zaheer.

163.title: SC to hear Uddhav faction's plea against Speaker's decision on party whip
163.article_body: The Supreme Court has agreed to hear a plea by former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's faction against the Assembly Speaker Rahul Narwekar's decision to recognise Shiv Sena's new whip. The matter will be heard on July 11, after the court's summer break. "The Speaker has no jurisdiction to recognise whips," said senior advocate Abhishek Singhvi, representing the Thackeray group.

164.title: Ajay Devgn to direct Hindi remake of Tamil movie 'Kaithi'
164.article_body: Actor-director Ajay Devgn is all set to direct 'Bholaa' starring Tabu and himself in the lead roles. The upcoming film is the Hindi remake of 'Kaithi', a Tamil action-thriller which featured Karthi, Arjun Das and Narain among others in pivotal roles. Ajay has previously directed films like 'U Me Aur Hum', 'Shivaay' and 'Runway 34'.

165.title: Ronaldo has ego; wants to leave Man Utd because of Messi reason: Ex-player
165.article_body: Former Irish footballer Tony Cascarino has said that Manchester United's Cristiano Ronaldo wants to leave the English club because of the fear of Paris Saint-Germain's Lionel Messi overtaking him as UEFA Champions League's top goalscorer. "Ronaldo...has an ego... I'm a bit suspicious because he's got 141 goals in the Champions League. Messi has got 125," Cascarino said.

166.title: Court issues bailable warrant against Raut in ₹100 crore defamation case
166.article_body: A court in Mumbai on Monday issued a bailable warrant against Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut in a defamation case of ₹100 crore filed by BJP leader Kirit Somaiya's wife. The warrant was issued after Raut failed to appear before court. Earlier, Raut had claimed that Somaiya and his wife were involved in a public toilets scam worth ₹100 crore.

167.title: Farmers' body says govt didn't fulfil promises, warns of protests
167.article_body: Farmers' body Samyukta Kisan Morcha (SKM) on Sunday accused the Centre of not delivering on the promises made to them in exchange of withdrawing protests last year. It said that the government neither formed a committee on MSP nor withdrew cases against farmers. It said it will start an agitation, "Protest Against Betrayal", during the monsoon session of Parliament.

168.title: China asks Canada to 'stop meddling' in Hong Kong affairs
168.article_body: China has asked Canada to "stop meddling" in Hong Kong affairs. This comes after Canadian Foreign Minister Melanie Joly said that Hong Kong's freedom was being suppressed under Chinese authority. "Hong Kong affairs are purely China's internal affairs, and no external forces are in the position to make irresponsible remarks," said the Chinese embassy in Ottawa.

169.title: We should be prepared for people speaking against us: Fadnavis
169.article_body: Soon after the Eknath Shinde-led government proved its majority in Maharashtra Assembly, the state's Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said that everyone should be prepared to listen to adversary's voices in politics. "We've seen that people were jailed for making statements...We should be prepared for people speaking against us. We should respond to criticism but in a proper way," he said.

170.title: JD(U), BJP in search of their own Eknath Shinde: Chirag Paswan
170.article_body: Lok Janshakti Party’s (LJP) Chirag Paswan said that the JD(U) and its ally BJP were in search of "their own Eknath Shinde", in Bihar. Furthermore, Paswan said that the two parties are in alliance “just for the sake of power”. "Both are trying to pull the ally down," he added while addressing a press conference.

171.title: Twinkle attends Adele concert, pride walk with Akshay in London, shares video
171.article_body: Actress-turned-author Twinkle Khanna and Akshay Kumar attended Adele's concert and a pride walk in London recently. She took to Instagram on Sunday to share a video capturing "one of the best days of [her] life". "The best thing about...best day is it happens unexpectedly...Happiness is accidental...It only collides against you when you are looking the other way," she wrote.

172.title: Seniors forced me to massage their bodies, harassed me: Sprinter Dutee Chand
172.article_body: India's fastest female sprinter Dutee Chand revealed that her seniors used to force her to massage their bodies when she was at the sports hostel in Bhubaneswar. She added they also used to force her to wash their clothes. "When I opposed them...they used to harass me," she stated. "It used to take a mental toll on me," Dutee said.

173.title: Getting threat calls asking to not take Kerala CM's name: Swapna Suresh
173.article_body: Swapna Suresh, who is the prime accused in Kerala gold smuggling case, said that she is getting threat calls. "They are demanding not to take the names of Kerala CM, his wife, daughter and MLA KT Jaleel. Someone with the name of Maradu Aneesh is doing this...They are threatening to kill me," she added.

174.title: India to drop windfall tax if oil prices fall $40 a barrel: Revenue Secretary
