174.article_body: India will withdraw its windfall tax for oil producers and refiners only if global prices of crude oil fall to $40 a barrel from present levels, said Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj. Last week, the Centre imposed a ₹23,230 per tonne additional tax on domestically produced crude oil to take away windfall gains accruing to producers from high international oil prices.

175.title: Heart-rending: PM Modi condoles loss of lives in Himachal bus accident
175.article_body: PM Narendra Modi condoled loss of lives in a bus accident in Himachal's Kullu and called the incident "heart-rending". "In this tragic hour my thoughts are with the bereaved families. I hope those injured recover at the earliest," PM said. He also announced ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh each for the next of kin of those who died in the accident.

176.title: Ex-MLA pays ₹20 lakh to hitmen to kill daughter in Bihar; arrested
176.article_body: A former MLA Surendra Sharma was apprehended on Sunday for allegedly ordering his daughter's "honour killing" after she married a man from another caste in Bihar's Patna, police said. The hitmen, whom Sharma paid ₹20 lakh, revealed the information, the city's SP (East) Pramod Kumar said. An attempt to kill the woman was made earlier this month, he added.

177.title: Gill, Vihari missed opportunity to cement their places: Jaffer on Eng Test
177.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer said Shubman Gill and Hanuma Vihari missed their opportunities to cement their place in India after failing to convert their knocks into big scores in the ongoing England Test. "Players like Sarfaraz Khan are knocking on the door and even Suryakumar Yadav is available. So yes to some extent [they have missed a chance]," stated Jaffer.

178.title: Neither yours nor for your son, it’s BJP’s turn: Shah to KCR on T'gana CM post
178.article_body: Union Home Minister and BJP leader Amit Shah on Sunday said as the country moves forward, Telangana is lagging behind. "KCR (Telangana CM) doesn't care about your source of livelihood…He just wants to make his son CM. KCR, the next turn is neither yours nor for your son. The next turn is meant for the BJP," Shah said in Hyderabad.

179.title: Federer receives standing ovation as he enters Wimbledon's Centre Court, video viral
179.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Roger Federer receiving a standing ovation as he entered the Wimbledon's Centre Court for a ceremony on Sunday. The ceremony marked the centenary of Centre Court. "Of course, I’ve missed being here. I would have loved to be here," said Federer, who is not taking part in the ongoing Wimbledon.

180.title: Delhi man hits 3 members of a family, strikes their dog's head with iron rod over barking
180.article_body: A man attacked three members of a family in Delhi and struck their dog on its head with an iron pipe after it barked at him. He also picked up the dog by its tail and threw it away. The dog's owner intervened, leading to a scuffle with the man, who was bitten by the dog in the meantime.

181.title: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde wins trust vote
181.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde-led state government proved its majority in the Assembly on Monday as it surpassed the majority mark of 144. It comes a day after BJP's Rahul Narwekar was elected the Assembly Speaker. Earlier in the day, Narwekar reinstated CM Eknath Shinde as Shiv Sena legislature party leader.

182.title: Tiger Shroff to team up with Shashank Khaitan for an action film: Reports
182.article_body: Actor Tiger Shroff and filmmaker Shashank Khaitan are reportedly teaming up for an action film. Production is expected to begin in August in Portugal. According to reports, the yet-untitled film will be shot at Belém Tower, Aveiro, Serra da Estrela (Portugal's highest mountain range) and the Palácio Nacional da Pena among many others. Tiger is currently working on 'Ganapath'.

183.title: Chanderpaul, who scored over 10,000 Test runs, appointed coach of US women teams
183.article_body: Ex-West Indies batter Shivnarine Chanderpaul has been appointed head coach of the US senior women's and the Under-19 teams for 18 months. "I've enjoyed being involved in American cricket over the years as a resident of Orlando, so to be given this opportunity...is incredible," stated Chanderpaul, who's one of the 14 cricketers to score more than 10,000 Test runs.

184.title: Tesla free to come but its special treatment not in India's interest: Ola CEO
184.article_body:
Ola Electric's CEO Bhavish Aggarwal has said, "Tesla is free to come in and put up a shop here...They just want to be treated differently from others, which I believe isn't in the interests of India." Earlier, Tesla CEO Elon Musk had said the company won't build its manufacturing
plant in any location where it can't sell its cars first.

185.title: 12-year-old cancer patient made Prayagraj Police ADG for a day
185.article_body: A 12-year-old cancer patient was made the Additional Director General (ADG) of Prayagraj Police for a day. ADG (Prayagraj zone), Prem Prakash, also gifted a body kit to the boy. Reports said that the boy asked questions about the police functioning and also browsed the documents while sitting on chair of ADG. He reportedly also signed and forwarded some reports.

186.title: 77 including 23 kids kept in church's basement, freed in Nigeria
186.article_body: Police have freed 77 people, including 23 children, kept in a church's basement in Nigeria's Ondo by pastors preaching to them about Christian believers ascending to heaven with Jesus Christ's second coming, authorities said. The incident came to light after a woman raised an alarm over a possible kidnapping, locals said. Two pastors are in custody, a police spokesperson said.

187.title: 31 bodies, some decomposing, found at funeral home in US
187.article_body: As many as 31 bodies were found at a funeral home in US' Indiana, following which the police launched an investigation. Some bodies were said to be in the advanced stages of decomposition. The cremated remains of 16 people were also found at the Lankford Funeral Home and Family Center. The remains were taken to the coroner's office for identification.

188.title: Congress in Gujarat exists only on paper: Arvind Kejriwal
188.article_body: AAP National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal said Congress party in Gujarat largely exists only on paper. "The office-bearers of AAP have to ensure that not a single vote is cast for Congress in Assembly elections," Kejriwal added. "We'll have our booth level organisation in place next month. By then, we'll have built an organisation bigger than BJP in Gujarat," he stated.

189.title: Pant did no wonders, it was England bowlers' fault: Mohammad Asif
189.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Mohammad Asif has said India's Rishabh Pant's 146(111) during their first innings in the ongoing Test against England was "England bowlers' fault". He added, "Pant did no wonders...he managed to score a century because English bowlers didn't bowl to him in his weak areas." With his hundred, Pant has become the youngest wicketkeeper-batter to reach 2,000 Test runs.

190.title: Opposing car shed at Aarey is like opposing environment: Fadnavis
190.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis has said that opposing the metro car shed project in Aarey colony is like opposing the environment. "This is a metro line that is in the interests of Mumbaikars...it will end the congestion and pollution in Mumbai," Fadnavis said. "Hence, we will evolve a consensus and complete this work," Fadnavis added.

191.title: India's Tejas is Malaysia's 'top choice' for MiG-29 replacement: HAL chief
191.article_body: India's light combat aircraft Tejas has emerged as Malaysia's "top choice" for replacing its fleet of Russian MiG-29 fighter planes, Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) chairman R Madhavan said. "I am very confident about the deal, unless some political shift takes place," Madhavan added. If the deal is sealed, it will give a "very good signal" to other buyers, he said.

192.title: Spartan Poker's 'Spartanverse' aims to lead metaverse gaming revolution
192.article_body: Online poker platform Spartan Poker announced its entry into the metaverse with the launch of 'Spartanverse'. Honouring legends of the Indian poker fraternity, it has a virtual Hall-of-Fame, hosting all the winners of India Online Poker Championship (IOPC), it revealed. "(It's the) first step towards building an immersive, virtual and futuristic poker experience," Founder & CEO Amin Rozani added.

193.title: Kishore said Madhubala had hole in heart, will live for 2 yrs: Actress' sister
193.article_body: Late actress Madhubala's sister Madhur Bhushan said that late singer Kishore Kumar had broken the news of Madhubala having a hole in her heart to her family and had said she will live only for two years. She added that Kumar had told them there is no cure for her condition and that their mother had fainted upon hearing news.

194.title: Prabhas is super friendly, he feeds people with so much love: Co-star Shruti
194.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan opened up about her experience of working with Prabhas in the upcoming film 'Salaar'. Calling him "super chilled out" and "super friendly", Shruti said it was really nice to work with him. She further said Prabhas feeds people with "so much love", adding that it's one of his best qualities. 'Salaar' is expected to release in 2023.

195.title: Video captures moment glacier collapses in Italian Alps; 6 killed, 8 injured
195.article_body: Parts of a mountain glacier collapsed in the Italian Alps on Sunday amid record temperatures, local authorities said, killing at least six people and injuring eight. A video has captured the moment an ice mass collapsed down the slopes of Marmolada, which at more than 3,300 metres is the highest mountain in the Dolomites.

196.title: It was reckless batting: Pietersen on Stokes' wicket in 5th Test vs India
196.article_body: Ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen has criticised England captain Ben Stokes for his batting during their first innings in the ongoing Test against India. "I was watching Stokes run down the wicket and slog the ball straight into the air. It was reckless batting...He's too good a player [for] this," stated Pietersen. Stokes was dropped twice before being dismissed on 25(36).

197.title: People say Kishore converted to Islam to marry, that's not true: Madhubala's sister
197.article_body: Talking about late singer Kishore Kumar's marriage with Madhubala, the late actress' youngest sister said, "A lot of people say that Kishore had converted to Islam to marry Madhu apa, but that’s not true." She added, "He was a Hindu and he passed away a Hindu. None of the husbands who married into our family changed their religion."

198.title: Maha Speaker reinstates Eknath Shinde as Shiv Sena legislature party leader
198.article_body: Maharashtra Assembly Speaker, Rahul Narwekar, has reinstated state Chief Minister Eknath Shinde as Shiv Sena legislative party leader. The Speaker has also reinstated Bharat Gogawale as the party's Chief Whip. News Agency ANI reported that appointment of Ajay Chaudhary as legislative party leader has been set aside by the Speaker.

199.title: Goenka shares pic with 'lookalike' Maharashtra CM, says 'My security can be a nuisance'
199.article_body: RPG Enterprises' Chairman Harsh Goenka on Sunday tweeted a photo of himself with Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde while referring to the similarities in their appearance. Goenka tweeted, "To those who come to meet me, sorry for any [inconvenience]. I know my Z+ security can be a nuisance. Look forward to your support. Jai Maharashtra!"

200.title: Overcast conditions, light showers likely in Delhi today: IMD
200.article_body: Overcast conditions are likely to prevail in Delhi on Monday, with the city likely to get 'light to moderate' thundershowers in the evening. According to the forecast of the India Meteorological Department (IMD), the minimum temperature in the capital will be around 27 degrees Celsius, while the maximum temperature will be 36 degrees Celsius.

201.title: Will give all donations to charity: Amazon delivery boy who saved Thane girl
201.article_body: An Amazon delivery agent, who helped in saving a child after part of a metal gate pierced through her cheek while she was playing in her school in Thane, said that he would give all the money he received as donations to charity. "My phone has been ringing constantly...with people from several states in India calling me," the agent said.

202.title: 16, including school children, dead after private bus falls into gorge in Himachal's Kullu
202.article_body: At least 16 people, including some school children, died after a private bus fell into a gorge in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu district. The bus was travelling from Shansher to Sainj when the incident happened. The driver reportedly lost control and the bus fell 200 metres into the gorge. The bus is said to be carrying more than 40 passengers.

203.title: 50-yr-old labourer falls off 6th floor in Delhi, contractor booked
203.article_body: A 50-year-old labourer was severely injured after falling off the sixth floor of a building undergoing repair in Delhi's Dwarka. The police booked the contractor after the victim complained that he did not provide proper equipment for work. The victim said that despite flagging the danger of using a loosely-tied bamboo seat for work, the contractor didn't make suitable arrangements.

204.title: India sees 16,135 new COVID-19 cases, 24 deaths; active cases reach 1,13,864
204.article_body: India has reported 16,135 COVID-19 cases, 13,958 recoveries and 24 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 16,103 cases and 31 deaths. Notably, India's active COVID-19 cases jumped to 1,13,864, while the death toll reached 5,25,223.

205.title: 25 dead, 53 injured in Mumbai last month due to monsoon mishaps: BMC data
205.article_body: Mumbai witnessed 25 deaths and 53 people were injured in more than 600 rain-related incidents in June, according to Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) data. The highest number of victims (19 deaths) were reported in the Kurla building collapse incident. The civic body has identified 382 dilapidated buildings this monsoon season, of which people still reside in 199 such buildings.

206.title: Why don’t you rename Ahmedabad to Adanibad?: KTR on BJP’s demand to rename Hyd
206.article_body: After BJP leader and ex-Jharkhand CM Raghubar Das said Hyderabad’s name will be changed to Bhagyanagar if BJP comes to power in Telangana, TRS leader KT Rama Rao asked, "Why don’t you change Ahmedabad’s name to Adanibad first?" Meanwhile, speaking about BJP’s national executive meet, BJP’s Ravi Shankar Prasad said, "PM Modi said that Hyderabad is Bhagyanagar."

207.title: 4 killed, 7 injured in lightning strikes in UP's Sitapur
207.article_body: Four people were killed and seven others injured after being struck by lightning in separate incidents in Uttar Pradesh’s Sitapur on Sunday. Two of the deceased were working in a field when they were struck by lightning. The SDM said that district administration will provide ₹4 lakh as financial compensation to the deceased’s families. The bodies were sent for post-mortem.

208.title: Iran cuts price of its crude oil in China amid competition with Russia: Report
208.article_body: Iran has discounted its crude oil price in China amid competition with Russia, as per a report. Russian exports to China surged to a record level in May, making it China's biggest supplier of oil and displacing Saudi Arabia from that position. Notably, China's official data only lists three months of imports from Iran since the end of 2020.

209.title: When I got a call for 'Ms Marvel', I had to pinch myself: Farhan
209.article_body: Actor Farhan Akhtar, who plays the role of Waleed in 'Ms Marvel', has said he's a huge fan of Marvel Cinematic Universe. "So when I got a call from my agent...that 'They're looking for someone out of India and are hoping you'll do this part,' I'd to pinch myself," he added. Farhan appeared in the fourth episode of the show.

210.title: We had to stay patient, wait for England batters to make mistakes: Siraj
210.article_body: After England were bundled out for 284 in their first innings in the ongoing rescheduled Test, India's Mohammed Siraj said they focused on the basics and waited for the England batters to make mistakes. He added that the plan was to hit one area consistently as the ball was "keeping low" on occasions. India ended Day 3 at 125/3.

211.title: Lalu Prasad Yadav falls from stairs at wife's home, fractures shoulder; hospitalised
211.article_body: Rashtriya Janata Dal leader Lalu Prasad Yadav was admitted to Paras Hospital in Patna. He was hospitalised after he reportedly lost his balance and fell down the stairs at his wife Rabri Devi's residence yesterday. News agency ANI reported that Yadav has suffered a minor fracture in his right shoulder, following which, his health deteriorated.

212.title: Neesham trolls Kohli for sledging Bairstow, says 'Give him a gift basket each morning'
212.article_body: New Zealand all-rounder Jimmy Neesham trolled Virat Kohli for sledging Jonny Bairstow on Day 3 of the rescheduled fifth Test. "Why do opposing teams keep making...Bairstow angry lol, he gets 10x better," Neesham wrote. He added, "Give him a gift basket each morning, let him know you're having his car valeted while he's batting. Anything to keep him happy."

213.title: Team India opener smashes fifty in a Test at Edgbaston for the first time after 36 years
213.article_body: Cheteshwar Pujara on Sunday became the first India opener to smash a fifty in a Test at Edgbaston in 36 years. Prior to Pujara, Sunil Gavaskar was the last India opener to smash a Test fifty at Edgbaston in 1986. Between Gavaskar and Pujara's fifties, Gautam Gambhir's 38(64) in 2011 was the highest score by an India opener at Edgbaston.

214.title: Broke leg, hand gestures became famous as Bobby Deol style: Bobby on 'Gupt...'
214.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol said that he had broken his leg while shooting for the movie 'Barsaat'. "And 'Gupt: The Hidden Truth' was immediately after that. I had an accident on the former's last day, so Chinni and Rekha Prakash ji made those hand movements of mine, which became popular as 'Bobby Deol's style'," he added.

215.title: Sri Lanka extends school closures amid unprecedented fuel crisis
215.article_body: Sri Lanka extended school closures for one more week starting July 4 amid unprecedented fuel crisis. The government and state-approved private schools will remain closed as there's not enough fuel for teachers and parents to get children to classrooms. Last month, the schools were shut nationwide for a day and remained closed in urban areas for the last two weeks.

216.title: Policeman shot at by terrorists in his home in J&K's Anantnag
216.article_body: A policeman was injured after he was shot at by terrorists in his home in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag on Sunday, police officials said. A police spokesperson said that the policeman had been taken to a hospital. "Investigation is in progress and officers continue to work to establish the full circumstances of this terror crime," an officer said.

217.title: Over 1 million people got jobs in past 2 yrs on Rozgar Bazaar: Delhi govt
217.article_body: The Delhi government has claimed that over one million people got jobs through its digital job matching portal, Rozgar Bazaar since its launch on July 27, 2020. Jobs across 32 job categories have been generated till June 2022, the government said. Notably, the platform was launched to help entry-level and blue-collar job seekers connect with employers during COVID-19-induced lockdown.

218.title: Harshal smashes 54(36) as India win 2nd T20 warm-up match by 10 runs
218.article_body: Team India defeated Northamptonshire by 10 runs to win the second and final T20 warm-up game on Sunday. India were 8/3 at one point in the game but Harshal Patel smashed 54 off 36 to help his side reach 149/8. The 31-year-old then picked two wickets, conceding 23 runs as Northamptonshire were bundled out for 139 in 19.3 overs.

219.title: Organs of brain dead auto-rickshaw driver save 4 lives in Delhi
219.article_body: A 45-year-old auto-rickshaw driver from Bihar, Karu Singh, was declared brain dead at Delhi's AIIMS. His family decided to donate his organs, which helped save four patients' lives. Singh's heart was transplanted to a 40-year-old woman, his liver to a 62-year-old man, one of his kidneys to a 56-year-old woman and the other to a 37-year-old woman.

220.title: Half genuine, half sponsored: Fadnavis on protests against Aarey car shed
220.article_body: The newly elected Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said that the issue created around shifting Metro-3 car shed project back to Aarey is "half genuine and half sponsored" and added that it was "only solution to Mumbai's congestion". "Work was paused after 25% of it had been completed. The cost has already been escalated by ₹10,000 crore," Fadnavis further said.

221.title: Firm loses ₹15 lakh from account in suspected cyber attack in Pune
221.article_body: An engineering firm lost ₹15 lakh from its bank account within hours in an alleged cyber attack in Pune. According to the FIR, the money was siphoned off after a beneficiary was fraudulently added in the firm's bank account and the transaction limit was raised from ₹2 lakh. The money was siphoned in six transfers, added the FIR.

222.title: We rob bank, you rob whole nation; Bye Bye Modi: Money Heist posters in Hyd
222.article_body: 'Money Heist' themed poster was seen in Hyderabad amid the BJP national executive meeting. "We only rob bank, you rob the whole nation," the poster said, adding, "Bye Bye Modi." The poster also mentioned names of states including Uttarakhand, Arunachal Pradesh, Karnataka, Maharashtra and Bihar. Reports said photos and videos of 'Money Heist' mascots on Hyderabad streets were also shared.

223.title: Truck hits 4 vehicles after brakes fail in Pune; 3 killed, 2 hurt
223.article_body: Three people, including an infant, were killed and two others injured after a truck hit two cars and two bikes near Lavale Phata in Pune on Sunday. The truck, which was carrying tiles, was on a steep slope when the driver lost control as the vehicle's brakes apparently failed, according to officials. The truck driver was arrested in the matter.

224.title: Rohit Sharma tests negative for COVID-19, begins net practice
224.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma is out of isolation and was seen at the nets after having tested negative for COVID-19. Rohit missed the ongoing rescheduled Test against England after he tested positive during the four-day warm-up game against Leicestershire. He's expected to be available for the white-ball series against England that begins with the first T20I on July 7.

225.title: Lost states because of BJP's superior money power: Cong's Abhishek Singhvi
225.article_body: Congress leader Abhishek Singhvi said the party lost some states because of the "climate of fear", successfully created by the PM Narendra Modi-led government by misusing central agencies. On being asked, from Karnataka to Maharashtra, non-BJP parties have not been able to retain power in many states, Singhvi said, "Yes, we've lost these states because of BJP's superior money power."

226.title: British Army's Twitter & YouTube briefly hacked, posts made on NFTs & Musk
226.article_body: The British Army regained control of its Twitter and YouTube accounts on Sunday after they were briefly hacked. While the YouTube channel was renamed 'Ark Invest' and videos on cryptocurrency with images of the world's richest man Elon Musk appeared there, the Twitter account retweeted several posts related to NFTs. The Army later said it will investigate the incident.

227.title: 22-year-old gunman opens fire at Denmark mall; 3 killed, several wounded
227.article_body: A gunman opened fire inside a busy shopping mall in Copenhagen on Sunday, killing three people and critically wounding three others, police said. A 22-year-old Danish man was arrested after the shooting, police added. According to police, the victims included a man in his 40s and two young people while several others were injured, three of them critically.

228.title: Who is 21-year-old Sini Shetty, winner of Miss India 2022?
228.article_body: Sini Shetty, who has been crowned Miss India 2022, was born in Maharashtra's Mumbai and is 21 years old. She hails from Karnataka. She did her schooling from St Dominic Savio Vidyalaya in Mumbai. She holds a bachelor's degree in accounting and finance and is currently pursuing a course in Chartered Finance Analyst (CFA). She is also a Bharatanatyam dancer.

229.title: History-sheeter arrested for stealing gold, silver from Pune flat
229.article_body: A 34-year-old man was arrested for breaking into a Pune flat and stealing about a kilogram of gold and three kilograms of silver ornaments. The incident occurred on June 20, when the target family had gone out to buy a puppy. According to the police, the accused is a history-sheeter with 18 cases of burglary against him.

230.title: 17-yr-old boy fined ₹17,500 for posting bike stunt videos in B'luru
230.article_body: A 17-year-old boy who performed bike stunts and posted them on social media was fined ₹17,500 in Bengaluru, police said on Sunday. Cases were filed based on the videos, which showed the stunts could be "dangerous" for others, Joint Police Commissioner (Traffic) BR Ravikanthe Gowda said. As the boy is a minor, cases were filed against his parents, he added.

231.title: Hyd man killed, body set ablaze by wife's family for marrying against choice
231.article_body: A 25-year-old man, a resident of Hyderabad, was killed and his body was set on fire by his wife's family as they objected to couple's marriage. Police said the two got married last year but wife's family did not approve of their marriage and forcibly took her away. Her family called victim on pretext of resolving differences and killed him.

232.title: Shinde govt may fall in next 6 months, be prepared for mid-term polls: Pawar
232.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar said that the newly formed Eknath Shinde-led government in Maharashtra is likely to fall in the next six months and everyone should be prepared for mid-term elections in the state. He further added that many rebel MLAs are not happy with the current arrangement and once the ministerial portfolios are distributed, their unrest will come out.

233.title: MCD doubles fines for mosquito breeding at houses, construction sites
233.article_body: Municipal Corporation of Delhi has doubled the fine for mosquito breeding in households, offices and construction sites as well as in containers in home and office spaces. As per the new slab, for residential areas, the fines have been increased to ₹100 per container from ₹50 and for commercial office and educational premises, it has become ₹200 from ₹100.

234.title: Karnataka's 21-year-old Sini Shetty crowned Miss India 2022
234.article_body: Mumbai-born 21-year-old Sini Shetty, who hails from Karnataka, was named Miss India 2022 at the 58th Femina Miss India beauty pageant. Miss India 2020 Manasa Varanasi crowned Sini, who will go on to represent India at the next edition of the Miss World pageant. Meanwhile, 21-year-old Shinata Chauhan was declared the second runner-up and Rubal Shekhawat was named first runner-up.

235.title: Cheteshwar Pujara slams fifty as India lead England by 257 runs after Day 3
235.article_body: India ended the third day of the rescheduled fifth Test at 125/3 in the second innings, leading England by 257 runs. Cheteshwar Pujara is unbeaten on 50*(139), while Rishabh Pant is unbeaten on 30*(46). Earlier in the day, England were dismissed for 284 runs in their first innings, with Mohammed Siraj picking four wickets.

236.title: North Korea criticises US, South Korea, Japan tripartite agreement
236.article_body: Pyongyang has criticised the recent agreement between the US, South Korea and Japan to explore further means of reinforcing "extended deterrence" against North Korea. It said the agreement materialises an alliance like NATO. Pyongyang also said the US is "spreading rumour" about a "threat from North Korea" to gain military supremacy over the Asia-Pacific, North Korean state media reported Sunday.

237.title: Russian ship with stolen Ukrainian wheat held in Turkey: Ukraine
237.article_body: Turkish customs authorities have detained a Russian cargo ship carrying wheat stolen from Ukrainian territory, Ukraine's ambassador to Turkey said on Sunday. He said a future course of action regarding the ship will be reached after a meeting of investigators on Monday. Ukraine had previously asked Turkey to detain the ship, as per documents and an official cited by Reuters.

238.title: Working to fully safeguard US users' data: TikTok to US lawmakers
238.article_body: ByteDance owned TikTok has told US senators that it was working on an agreement to "fully safeguard user data and US national security interests," as per a letter. This comes amid claims that the social media app has leaked US user data to China. TikTok acknowledged that in the past Chinese employees had data access to US user data.

239.title: Twitter banned more than 46,000 accounts in India in May
239.article_body: Twitter banned more than 46,000 accounts of Indian users in May over violation of its guidelines, it said in its monthly compliance report on Sunday. While 43,656 accounts were removed over child sexual exploitation, non-consensual nudity, and similar content, some 2,870 accounts were banned for promoting terrorism. Between April 26 and May 25, Twitter received 1,698 complaints in India.

240.title: 102 people killed in Bangladesh floods so far
240.article_body: The death toll due to the floods in Bangladesh has reached 102, the country's Directorate General of Health Services said. The government agency said that among the deceased, 75 died by drowning, 15 from lightning strikes, two from snake bites, and the rest due to other reasons. The agency said the deaths occurred between May 17 and July 3.

241.title: Pavithra Lokesh claims media representatives stalking her, files complaint
241.article_body: Telugu and Kannada actress Pavithra Lokesh has filed a complaint in Mysuru's VV Puram Police Station claiming that some representatives of the media are stalking her. The actress has stated that they are destroying her peace of mind. She had earlier alleged that fake accounts with her name were made on social media that are making defamatory posts.

242.title: Sainz claims first F1 win at British GP after crash delays the race
242.article_body: Carlos Sainz won first career Formula One race on his 150th start at the British Grand Prix on Sunday. The Ferrari driver beat Red Bull's Sergio Perez and Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton. Part one of the race was red-flagged as Alfa Romeo driver Zhou Guanyu was stretchered off after a major crash on turn one. Championship leader Max Verstappen finished seventh.

243.title: WhatsApp may increase time limit of 'delete for everyone' feature: Report
243.article_body: Meta-owned messaging platform WhatsApp is beta testing the option to increase the time limit for its 'delete for everyone' feature, as per reports. According to WABetaInfo, which offers real-time updates about WhatsApp, the feature has been rolled out for beta testing to a limited number of users. The new limit for the update may be two days and 12 hours.

244.title: Amazon lets Prime users unsubscribe in 2 clicks after EU complaints
244.article_body: The European Commission has said that after complaints from consumer groups, Amazon has made it easier for users to cancel their Prime subscriptions in the region. Users can now unsubscribe with two clicks via a prominent and clear 'cancel button', the Commission said. As per the complaints, users had to earlier go through complicated menus, skewed wording and confusing choices.

245.title: Why is Australia killing millions of honeybees?
245.article_body: Australian authorities have killed over six million honeybees after an outbreak of the deadly varroa mite that was first reported in Sydney last week. The parasitic insect, known to be the biggest threat to bees worldwide, attacks and feeds on honeybees, crippling them and impairing their flight performance. The extermination is being done to save Australia's multimillion-dollar honey industry.

246.title: Don’t blame me: Rohit Shetty on high budget of Khatron Ke Khiladi 12
246.article_body: When asked if he's the reason why the budget of 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12' has increased, filmmaker Rohit Shetty replied, "Don’t blame me. 'Khatron Ke Khiladi' is an expensive show, I think by far one of the most expensive ones." "The scale and quality of the show require that kind of...budget. It has nothing to do with me," he added.

247.title: Sri Lanka struggling to raise $587mn to pay for fuel shipments: Lankan Minister
247.article_body: Sri Lanka needs to pay $587 million for several fuel shipments, said a top minister amid its worst financial crisis and crippling fuel shortage. The country is struggling to raise enough funds to pay for essential imports of items like fuel, food and medicines. Its central bank can supply only about $125 million, Power and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera said.

248.title: Madhubala's biopic will not include Kishore Kumar & Dilip Kumar: Madhur
248.article_body: Madhubala's sister Madhur Bhushan said the family wants to celebrate the actor through the biopic. "We are sure that we don’t want to hurt anybody while telling this tale. We don’t want to get into what happened with Dilip Kumar and Kishore Kumar," she added. "They've families, wives and children, too. Every relationship has its ups and downs," she said.

249.title: Two dead as boulder crushes car in Uttarakhand's Chamoli district
249.article_body: A couple was killed on Sunday in Uttarakhand's Chamoli district when a boulder rolled down a hill and crushed the car they were travelling in, police said. The accident took place on the Karnaprayag-Gwaldam national highway, police added. The deceased have been identified as 42-year-old Balbir Singh and his 40-year-old wife Savitri Devi.

250.title: Delhi govt adds Jagannath Puri Yatra under its free pilgrimage scheme
250.article_body: Delhi government will be sending pilgrims for Jagannath Puri Yatra in Odisha under its free pilgrimage scheme, officials said on Sunday. Two trains under the 'Mukhyamantri Tirth Yatra Yojana' will depart for Puri with the pilgrims on July 11 and July 28. The scheme, which was introduced in 2019, was suspended due to the pandemic and resumed in December 2021.

251.title: FPIs withdraw ₹50,203 crore in June, highest net outflow in 2 years
251.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) withdrew a net sum of ₹50,203 crore from equities in June, data showed. This is the highest net outflow since March 2020, when they pulled out ₹61,973 crore. Overall, in the first six months of 2022, FPIs pulled out around ₹2.2 lakh crore from domestic equities, which is the highest-ever net withdrawal by them.

252.title: NDMC plans to launch mobile education vans for labourers' children
252.article_body: The New Delhi Municipal Corporation (NDMC) plans to launch mobile school vans to educate labourers' kids and homeless kids. NDMC Vice Chairperson Satish Upadhyay said that before implementation, a feasibility survey will be conducted to identify the number of such students. Lauding Gujarat's 'school on wheels' initiative, he said that they will contact Gujarat education department for ideas.

253.title: HC to hear plea alleging Ram Rahim has been replaced with impostor
253.article_body: The Punjab & Haryana HC will hear a plea on Monday that seeks to "verify the authenticity" of Gurmeet Ram Rahim and ascertain if he has been replaced with an impostor. The petitioners, who have claimed to be followers of Dera Sacha Sauda, have listed multiple changes they claim they have noticed in Ram Rahim's figure and personality.

254.title: JSW Steel to invest ₹10,000cr to reduce carbon footprint: Chairman
254.article_body: JSW Steel has earmarked ₹10,000 crore for investments to reduce its carbon footprint, JSW Group Chairman Sajjan Jindal said. He added that this will be done by increasing the use of renewable energy to replace thermal power and reduce the firm's fuel rate, among others. "We have committed to reducing our CO2 emissions intensity...by 42% by 2030," Jindal said.

255.title: Chip business turnover expected to be around $3.5bn: Vedanta Group
255.article_body: Vedanta Group's global MD of display and semiconductor business Akarsh Hebbar said the firm expects its semiconductor business turnover to be in the range of $3 to $3.5 billion. "This will be from both display and semiconductor combined...We expect $1 billion to come from exports," he added. The firm has earmarked investments of up to $20 billion for the business.

256.title: Four of a family killed in Lakhimpur Kheri as bus hits motorcycle
256.article_body: Four members of a family, including three females, were killed in a road accident in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri on Sunday when a speeding bus hit their motorcycle, police said. The deceased, including a 7-year-old girl, were identified as residents of Dhaurahra village. The bodies have been sent for post-mortem and the driver of the bus has been arrested, police added.

257.title: Health emergency declared in Puducherry district over diarrhoea outbreak
257.article_body: Puducherry's Directorate of Health and Family Welfare Services has declared a public health emergency in Karaikal district, following an outbreak of acute diarrhoea over the last few days. Examination of drinking water samples in the region was found to be not safe for consumption, the  Health Director said. Citizens have been asked to drink boiled water and ensure personal hygiene.

258.title: PM Modi said that Hyderabad is Bhagyanagar: Ravi Shankar Prasad
258.article_body: Speaking about BJP's national executive meet in Hyderabad, BJP MP Ravi Shankar Prasad said, "PM Modi said that Hyderabad is Bhagyanagar which is significant for all of us." "Sardar Patel kept the foundation of a unified India and now it's BJP's responsibility to carry it further," he added. PM Modi addressed the meet on Sunday.

259.title: I have a dream that once I will do a negative role: Ranbir
259.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor said he once wants to play a negative role. "I've a dream that once I'll do a negative role and people will tell their kids ‘so jaa, so jaa nahi toh Ranbir aa jayega!'" "As our cinema evolves, the villain's character...is becoming complex and interesting. I’m looking forward to the bad guys we're yet to watch," he added.

260.title: Sorry had to kick out British player Watson: Jule on Wimbledon 4th round win
260.article_body: Germany's Jule Niemeier has entered maiden Grand Slam quarter-final on her Wimbledon debut, defeating Great Britain's Heather Watson 6-2, 6-4 in the fourth round on Sunday. "I can't believe it. I want to say sorry I had to kick out a British player today. The atmosphere was incredible," said Niemeier. The 22-year-old will now face compatriot Tatjana Maria.

261.title: Will restrain Centre from destabilising Oppn state govts: Sinha
261.article_body: The Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha has said that he won't hesitate to restrain Centre if it "aids and abets" the destabilisation of state governments run by Opposition parties. "I have declared that I shall speak out against any attempts aimed at communal polarisation...I have also announced that I shall work for the repeal of the sedition law," Sinha added.

262.title: Films don't fail, budgets do; producer shouldn't lose money: Taapsee
262.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu stated that films don't fail but budgets do, adding that it's a universal fact irrespective of whether it's Bollywood or Hollywood. "The most important fact should be that your producers shouldn't be losing money, this is true for an actor and actress," she added. Taapsee further said it is an actor's duty to keep that in mind.

263.title: 34-yr-old mother-of-two Maria enters 1st Slam singles quarters at Wimbledon
263.article_body: Unseeded German Tatjana Maria saved two match points to beat 12th seeded Jelena Ostapenko 5-7, 7-5, 7-5 in the fourth round at Wimbledon and reached her first Grand Slam singles quarter-final on Sunday. Notably, the 34-year-old mother of two, who returned from maternity leave less than a year ago, is the oldest player left in the women's draw.

264.title: Russian scientist dies days after arrest for state treason
264.article_body: A scientist who was arrested from Siberia earlier this week by Russian authorities on charges of state treason has died, his lawyer told Reuters on Sunday. Dmitry Kolker's lawyer said, "He died yesterday. Tomorrow we will lodge a complaint over his detention." Kolker was reportedly suffering from advanced pancreatic cancer. According to Kolker's family, he was detained from a hospital.

265.title: Cristiano Ronaldo wants to leave Manchester United: Reports
265.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo has told the Premier League club that he wants to leave the club because of his desire to play in the Champions League, UK's The Times newspaper reported on Saturday. The report added that the 37-year-old Portuguese footballer believes that he can play at the elite level for another "three of four years".

266.title: Pic of Tom Cruise's stunt from new 'Mission Impossible' surfaces
266.article_body: A picture has surfaced online showing actor Tom Cruise dangling from the wing of a plane as it does a nosedive and then performs a barrel roll. The stunt is from his upcoming film 'Mission: Impossible – Dead Reckoning Part One'. Tom reportedly also rides a motorcycle off the edge of a cliff and parachutes off in the film.

267.title: Katariya scores as India hold England to 1-1 draw in their women's hockey WC 2022 opener
267.article_body: Vandana Katariya scored in the 28th minute as India held England to a 1-1 draw in their women's hockey World Cup 2022 opener on Sunday. Katariya's equaliser came 19 minutes after England's Isabelle Petter opened the scoring. India will next face China in their Pool B clash on Tuesday. The World Cup is being held in Spain and Netherlands.

268.title: Hope to play Wimbledon one more time: 8-time champion Federer
268.article_body: Eight-time champion Roger Federer said he hopes to play Wimbledon "one more time". Attending a special ceremony to mark the 100th anniversary of Centre Court on Sunday, Federer stated, "This court has given me my biggest wins and my biggest losses." The Swiss hasn't played a competitive match since losing in quarter-final of last year's Championships to Poland's Hubert Hurkacz.

269.title: Pics show the moment a woman was eaten by shark in Egypt
269.article_body: A footage of a 68-year-old tourist from Austria being attacked by a shark in Egypt has surfaced online, following which the country's Red Sea Governorate ordered closure of several Red Sea beaches. The woman died in an ambulance after losing an arm and a leg in the attack. The footage showed the woman trying to swim back to shore.

270.title: I should have been a mom at 19, I was ready but it got delayed: Sushmita
270.article_body: Speaking about becoming a mother, actress Sushmita Sen said she wanted to adopt much earlier. "I was delayed as far as I was concerned, I should've been a mom at 19, I was ready," she said. "I...knew it was time and during Miss Universe is the first time I entered an adoption centre...Something inside [me] was not okay," she added.

271.title: 'Friends' creator gives $4mn to University due to guilt over show's lack of diversity
271.article_body: 'Friends' co-creator Marta Kauffman has said she's donating $4 million to Brandeis University after feeling "embarrassed" by and "guilty" over the sitcom's lack of diversity. Kauffman is donating the sum for an endowed professorship in the African and African American Studies Department. "It took me a long time to begin to understand how I internalised systemic racism," she said.

272.title: Ukrainian forces hit Russian military logistics base in Melitopol
272.article_body: Ukrainian forces struck a Russian military logistics base in Russia-occupied Melitopol on Sunday, the city's exiled mayor Ivan Fedorov said. "At 3 o'clock (0000 GMT) and 5 o'clock (0200 GMT), there were over 30 strikes on a single military base," Fedorov stated. A Russia-installed official confirmed the Ukrainian strikes but no information was provided regarding the target of the strikes.

273.title: KCR has no care for unemployment, only wants his son to be CM: Shah
273.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday said that Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao has no concern for the unemployed youth and only wants his son to be the CM of the state. Shah added he doesn't care about the people's source of livelihood, adding that the next term is reserved neither for his son nor him, but for BJP.

274.title: Telangana govt has become a symbol of corruption: Piyush Goyal
274.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Sunday said that the Telangana government has become a symbol of corruption, adding that the state's residents want a change. Goyal further stated that members from the same family hold key positions in the state government. His remarks came on the second day of the BJP's national executive meet, which was held in Secunderabad.

275.title: Will prove majority with 166 votes in tomorrow's floor test: Maha Deputy CM
275.article_body: Ahead of the newly-formed Maharashtra government's floor test in the Assembly on Monday, Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Sunday said, "We will prove our majority with 166 votes in tomorrow's vote of confidence." "The youngest Speaker candidate won the Speaker election with 164 votes today as 2 MLAs couldn't come due to health issues," Fadnavis added.

276.title: Kanye West sued for copyright infringement over sample on 'Flowers'
276.article_body: A copyright infringement lawsuit has been filed against rapper Kanye West for allegedly using a sample on his song 'Flowers' from his new album 'Donda 2'. Musician Marshall Jefferson has alleged that a sample from his 1986 song 'Move Your Body (House Music Anthem)' is "repeated at least 22 times throughout" 'Flowers' without gaining permission or providing compensation.

277.title: Death toll from landslide in Manipur's Noney reaches 42; 20 still missing
277.article_body: The death toll due to the landslide at Tupul railway station in Manipur's Noney increased to 42, after eight more bodies were recovered from under the debris during a search operation on Sunday. As per reports, the search operation may take a few more days. Around 20 persons are reportedly still missing.

278.title: Our fighter jets to guard Slovakia's airspace from Sept: Czech PM
278.article_body: Czech Republic's PM Petr Fiala said on Sunday that the country's fighter jets will begin guarding neighbouring Slovakia's airspace from September. The move comes after Slovakia requested its NATO allies to patrol its airspace as it decided to ground its Russian-made MiG-29 fighter jets. The MiG-29 fighter jets are likely to be sent to Ukraine amid the ongoing Russian invasion.

279.title: Centre to declare startup rankings of states on July 4
279.article_body: The results of the 3rd Ranking of States' on Support to Start-up Ecosystems will be released by Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Monday. Conducted by the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT), 24 states and 7 Union Territories participated in the exercise. The rankings encourage states, UTs to strengthen support to the startup ecosystem, the government stated.

280.title: World no. 66 Bouzkova reaches 1st Grand Slam quarters at Wimbledon
280.article_body: World number 66 Marie Bouzkova has reached her first Grand Slam quarter-final after beating France's Caroline Garcia 7-5, 6-2 in fourth round at Wimbledon on Sunday. "If you would tell me before the tournament started I'd be in the quarters, I probably wouldn't believe you," said Bouzkova. The 23-year-old Czech will next face either third-seeded Ons Jabeur or Elise Mertens.

281.title: Virat Kohli blows a kiss after taking catch to dismiss Bairstow, video goes viral
281.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli blew a kiss after taking a catch to dismiss Jonny Bairstow in England's first innings in the rescheduled fifth Test. Bairstow was dismissed on the bowling of Mohammad Shami. Bairstow scored 106 runs off 140 deliveries. Earlier in the innings, the duo were seen sledging each other.

282.title: Video shows truck powered by jet engines exploding while racing planes in US, 1 killed
282.article_body: The 40-year-old driver of a truck that was powered by jet engines was killed during a US airshow after the vehicle exploded. The accident was caught on video and it showed the vehicle catching on fire while racing two planes that were flying above it. Chris Darnell was killed while driving the truck at 300 miles (483 km) per hour.

283.title: Fan walked up my building's stairs to meet me, it was scary: Kiara
283.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani revealed that a fan once walked up all the stairs of her building to meet her, adding she lives on a very high floor. She said he wanted to tell her how much she means to him. "I was like...'Why? You could've just taken the lift...But don't come to my house next time, it's...scary also'," Kiara said.

284.title: Our approach is to dominate Sri Lanka Women in 2nd ODI: Vastrakar
284.article_body: India Women all-rounder Pooja Vastrakar said her side's approach is to dominate Sri Lanka Women in the second ODI in Pallekele. "We'll have our first game approach in the second match. And we would like to win the series 3-0," she added. The match will be played on Monday. India are leading the three-match series 1-0.

285.title: HDFC-HDFC Bank merger receives go-ahead from NSE and BSE
285.article_body: HDFC Bank and parent HDFC on Sunday said that they have received "no adverse observations" from BSE and "no objection" from the National Stock Exchange (NSE) for their merger. However, in separate regulatory filings, they noted that the proposed HDFC-HDFC Bank merger still requires approvals from the RBI, CCI and NCLT. The merger was announced in April this year.

286.title: Drake makes surprise appearance at Backstreet Boys' Toronto concert
286.article_body: Rapper Drake made a surprise appearance onstage during band Backstreet Boys' concert at the Budweiser stage in Canada's Toronto. A video which is going viral shows the band performing their 1999 song 'I Want It That Way' while Drake sings his 2013 song 'Hold On, We're Going Home' merged with it. Backstreet Boys is currently on their DNA World Tour.

287.title: I just hope the delivery is normal: Harsh Varrdhan on sister Sonam's pregnancy
287.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor's brother, actor Harsh Varrdhan, while talking to a news portal, revealed that he is excited about Sonam's pregnancy. "I am excited. Let’s just hope that the delivery is normal and Sonam is okay. Honestly speaking, I am not good with kids," he added. "It is a new experience for all of us," Harsh Varrdhan said.

288.title: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann likely to expand Cabinet on July 4
288.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann likely to induct five new ministers and expand the Cabinet on Monday, according to reports. The oath taking ceremony will take place in Raj Bhawan at 5 pm, reports quoted an official as saying. With this, the Punjab Cabinet will have 15 ministers, including the Chief Minister. This will be CM Mann's first Cabinet expansion.

289.title: WhatsApp working on feature to let users hide 'Online' status: Report
289.article_body: WhatsApp is reportedly working on a new feature that will allow users to hide their 'Online' status from specific contacts. Users will reportedly get to choose who can see when they are online by either selecting 'Everyone' or 'Same as Last Seen'. Notably, for 'Last Seen' status setting, users get four options: Everybody, My Contacts, My Contacts Except, and Nobody.

290.title: BJP will resolve all problems of Northeast by 2024: Amit Shah
290.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that BJP has found a permanent address to the issues in the Northeastern states. Speaking at the BJP national executive meet in Hyderabad, Shah said that all problems of the Northeast will be resolved by 2024 and the region will face no issues in the coming times.

291.title: Himachal Police holds constable exam for second time after paper leak
291.article_body: The constable recruitment exam for Himachal Police was held on Sunday, amid tight security, for the second time after a question paper leak led to the exam's cancellation in March. More than 75,000 candidates appeared for the examination this time. "There are flying squads, there are checking teams. We have frisking staff at every examination centre," said DIG Sumedha Dwivedi.

292.title: India gifts 75 ambulances and 17 school buses to Nepal
292.article_body: India on Sunday gifted 75 ambulances and 17 school buses to Nepal as part of its ongoing efforts to build on a "robust and longstanding" partnership between the two countries. The vehicles will be handed over to various governmental departments and NGOs working in healthcare and education sectors in various districts of Nepal, the Indian mission said.

293.title: NDRF deploys six teams in flood-prone districts of Gujarat
293.article_body: The NDRF on Sunday deployed six teams in various districts of Gujarat and placed them on standby to deal with possible floods caused by incessant rainfall in the state. Four teams have been sent to the Rajkot district and one each to the Surat and Banaskantha districts. In the Anand district, two people died after drowning in rainwater this week.

294.title: Only the best proposal from start-ups can attract funds: Mariwala
294.article_body: Marico Chairman Harsh Mariwala believes that corrections are happening in the start-up funding ecosystem. "With the funding environment tightened, now only the best proposal from start-ups can attract funds," he said. Mariwala further stated that funders are increasing time frames, but that it was justified because scaling of businesses and growth rate was also higher.

295.title: Taught me tremendous grace: Sushmita on winning Miss India & Miss Universe titles
295.article_body: Speaking about winning Miss India and Miss Universe titles, Sushmita Sen said, "Winning Miss Universe [was] making history for my country. One of the things that was ingrained while I left from here was, don't expect much, so that victory was a different victory altogether." "[It] taught me tremendous grace. It showed me generosity of spirit," she added.

296.title: IFS officer's video of cheetah climbing & sitting on tourist vehicle goes viral
296.article_body: Indian Forest Service (IFS) officer Surender Mehra shared a video of a cheetah climbing a tourist vehicle during a safari, which has gone viral on Twitter. The clip shows the animal climbing up onto the vehicle's spare wheel before reaching its roof and sitting down. "Man in wild," said Mehra while sharing the video.

297.title: Delhi L-G inspects drainage at waterlogged sites amid monsoons
297.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena inspected waterlogged sites such as Indraprastha-WHO stretch, Railway underpass at Pul Prahladpur and Minto Bridge. Officials were instructed to make drainage in these areas fool-proof. "The L-G instructed the officials to put in place a comprehensive plan consisting of long-term measures to deal with the problem of waterlogging," the L-G's office said.

298.title: Bairstow was playing like Pujara, Kohli unnecessarily made him Pant by sledging: Sehwag
298.article_body: Reacting to England's Jonny Bairstow's 106(140) against India in the rescheduled fifth Test, Virender Sehwag stated that Bairstow was playing like Cheteshwar Pujara, but Virat Kohli unnecessarily made him Rishabh Pant by sledging. Notably, Bairstow was batting on 13 runs from 61 deliveries before being sledged by Kohli. After the sledging, Bairstow made 93 runs off 79 balls.

299.title: IndiGo crew took mass leave on Air India recruitment day causing flight delays: Reports
299.article_body: A significant number of cabin crew members of IndiGo had taken sick leave on Saturday when Air India conducted its recruitment drive, reports said on Sunday. PTI reported that the staffers took leave from work and went for the recruitment drive. This came after DGCA took note of the massive delays in IndiGo flights reported on Saturday.

300.title: Banking frauds of over ₹100 crore decline by over 50% in FY22: Data
300.article_body: The number of banking sector frauds worth over ₹100 crore declined to 118 in FY22 from 265 in FY21, official data showed. As per data, banks reported cases worth ₹41,000 crore in FY22 compared to ₹1.05 lakh-crore last year. This comes as RBI carried out a study on the implementation of Early Warning System framework in select banks in 2021-22.

301.title: 70 illegal constructions demolished in Bihar's Patna using 20 bulldozers
301.article_body: The administration in Bihar's Patna on Sunday cleared 40 acres of land after demolishing 70 illegally constructed houses in Rajiv Nagar during a demolition drive carried out using 20 bulldozers. Over 12 people, who resisted the anti-encroachment drive, were arrested amid clashes with police. Patna SP, along with some other policemen, sustained injuries in clashes, DM Chandrashekhar Singh said.

302.title: 59,000 Tesla cars have faulty emergency call system: German authority
302.article_body: Germany's road traffic agency said it is recalling Tesla models Y and 3 over a software glitch that affects 59,129 Tesla vehicles globally. As per the agency, the glitch causes breakdown of the eCall, which is designed to automatically contact emergency responders in the event of serious accidents. This comes as Tesla reported an 18% decline in deliveries in Q2.

303.title: Egypt shuts down several beaches after woman dies in shark attack
303.article_body: Egypt's Red Sea Governorate has issued an order demanding closure of several Red Sea beaches following a 68-year-old Austrian woman's death in a shark attack off the coast of Sahl Hasheesh on Friday. The victim swam to the shore after being attacked on her arm and leg, witnesses said. She reportedly succumbed to her injuries in the ambulance.

304.title: Personal attack on judges lead to dangerous scenario: SC judge who heard Nupur's plea
304.article_body: Supreme Court judge Justice JB Pardiwala, who along with Justice Surya Kant heard Nupur Sharma's plea, criticised people for "personal attacks" on judges for their judgement. "Personal attacks on judges for their judgements lead to a dangerous scenario where judges have to think about what the media thinks instead of what the law really thinks," he stated.

305.title: Ex-Mumbai Police chief Sanjay Pandey summoned by ED in NSE co-location case
305.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned former Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey on July 5 in connection with a money laundering case related to the National Stock Exchange (NSE) co-location scam, an official said on Sunday. The summons was sent on Saturday to Pandey, who retired from the police force on June 30, the ED official added.

306.title: Amravati killing was portrayed as theft, will be probed: Fadnavis
306.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said on Sunday that the theft angle in the killing of a chemist in Amravati will be probed. "Accused...have been nabbed...NIA is investigating [the case to find]...if there's some international connection," he added. The victim, Umesh Kolhe, was murdered on June 21 over his online posts in support of suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma.

307.title: Vijay Deverakonda did a lot of posing routine for Liger's poster: Trainer
307.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda's trainer Kuldep Sethi said the actor was in good shape for Liger, but for the photoshoot, which they shot a year ago, he had to train a little extra. "We started training and I...changed a bit of his workout style... It was...tiring for him but with this routine, he also got to showcase his muscle," he added.

308.title: Lashkar terrorist caught in J&K was BJP IT cell member, had quit 2 months ago
308.article_body: One of the two Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorists who were caught by villagers in J&K's Reasi on Sunday was a BJP IT cell member. Talib Hussain had worked as Jammu BJP Minority Morcha's IT and social media in-charge. BJP Minority Morcha president Sheikh Bashir said Hussain was working with BJP for a "long time" and had resigned two months ago.

309.title: Messi is the best: Xavi on comparison between Ronaldo and Messi
309.article_body: Comparing Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi, Barcelona manager and former teammate of Messi, Xavi Hernandez said that Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) forward is the best in history, adding Messi does more things compared to the Manchester United forward. "Messi is the player that makes the most difference in the world. It's more than obvious," he added.

310.title: 2 men cheat Pune bank of ₹65 lakh by securing loan on forged docs
310.article_body: Two people allegedly cheated a private bank of ₹65 lakh by procuring loans using forged documents, reports said. In his complaint, the bank manager said that the accused used forged ITR documents and manipulated bank statements to apply for the loan. According to police sub-inspector S Girnar, one of the accused is associated with three more bank loan fraud cases.

311.title: 9-year-old boy dies as part of balcony collapses in Delhi's Rohini
311.article_body: A nine-year-old boy died after a portion of the balcony of an old house collapsed in the Begum Vihar area of Delhi's Rohini, police said. According to Rohini DCP Pranav Tayal, the boy was playing in front of the house when the incident took place. He was taken to a hospital, where he succumbed to his injuries, the DCP added.

312.title: Siblings impersonate beggars to commit theft, arrested in Mumbai
312.article_body: Mumbai Police have arrested three people who pretended to be beggars and stole from multiple households, reports have stated. The accused, identified as Satyababa (40), Nisha (22) and Pooja (25), are siblings who hail from Maharashtra's Ahmednagar and had travelled to Mumbai along with a child with an intent to commit theft. They have been placed under judicial custody.

313.title: Rahul Gandhi stops car, helps man injured in road accident in Kerala; video surfaces
313.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi recently helped a man injured in road accident in Kerala's Wayanad, a video of which has surfaced online. Rahul stopped his car on seeing the injured man and helped in taking him to a hospital in his convoy's ambulance. The video shows him helping with the stretcher while the man was being taken to the ambulance.

314.title: BJP govt in K'taka trying to communalise school curriculum: Sinha
314.article_body: The opposition candidate for the Presidential polls, Yashwant Sinha, on Sunday said that the BJP government in Karnataka was attempting to communalise the school curriculum in the state. He accused the Central government of launching repeated assaults on democracy and secularism. He added that the Centre has "unleashed poisonous communal propaganda to divide India's multi-religious society".

315.title: Johnny Depp gets tattoo of broken arrow post defamation case win
315.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp got a tattoo of a broken arrow on his underwrist a month after winning the defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard. The process reportedly took six hours. As per reports, a broken arrow signifies "a new start and new hope" after "burying the battle ax". Pictures and videos of Depp getting the tattoo are going viral.

316.title: BJP MP asks Raj CM to get mental treatment after nikamma remark for Minister
316.article_body: BJP MP Ashok Bajpai took a jibe at Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot for calling Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat "nikamma", saying that the CM should get mental treatment. He added that the CM's old age is visible in his conduct, adding that Shekhawat has worked hard to provide tap water in a short period of time.

317.title: Russia claims full control of Ukraine's Luhansk region as its last city falls
317.article_body: Russia on Sunday said it has taken control of eastern Ukraine's Luhansk region after the fall of the region's last Ukrainian holdout. The city of Lysychansk, which was a key Ukrainian city, and some nearby settlements fell under the control of Russian forces on Sunday, Russia claimed. Ukraine is, however, yet to comment on Russian claims.

318.title: 22-yr-old law student killed, his body thrown in UP drain; police probe role of gay app
318.article_body: Yash Rastogi, a 22-year-old law student, was killed and his body was thrown in a drain in gunny bag in UP's Meerut, police said. Three accused, reportedly identified as Shavej, Imran and Salman, have been arrested. Police are investigating the role of a gay app they were associated with amid reports that Yash blackmailed the accused with their objectionable video.

319.title: 200 families left homeless in Assam's Barpeta as river wipes out houses
319.article_body: Over 200 families in the Kachumara area of Assam's Barpeta district have been forced to move to other safer places after the Brahmaputra river wiped out their houses and several bighas of land. "Many roads of this area are also damaged due to river erosion," a local resident said. So far, at least 174 have died in Assam amid floods.

320.title: B'wood is playing safe by remaking films & not creating original content: Neil
320.article_body: Actor Neil Nitin Mukesh said that Bollywood tries to ‘play it safe’ by remaking films and not creating original content. "There are various sub-genres, like psychological thrillers, political thrillers, horror thrillers and so on. Why aren’t we exploring those?" he added. "We are still remaking films instead of coming up with original ideas and content," Neil said.

321.title: Akhilesh like Mughal emperors who oppressed kin for power: BJP MP
321.article_body: BJP MP Dinesh Lal Yadav on Sunday likened SP chief Akhilesh Yadav to the Mughal emperors, who he said oppressed their kin for the sake of power. "Reawakened Muslim and Yadav voters after 2014 have shattered the hope of the SP, which used to claim a monopoly over them," he said. SP is turning into a "samaptwadi party," he added.

322.title: AAP expanding in Guj, people tired of 27 yrs of BJP: Kejriwal
322.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said that AAP is expanding on a huge scale in Gujarat, adding that the people of the state are tired of 27 years of the BJP. "BJP thinks Congress can't replace them, so they've developed ego. People are looking with hope towards AAP this time," he said.

323.title: BJP govt's policy is Gandhi in abroad & Godse in India: Yechury
323.article_body: CPI(M)'s Sitaram Yechury has criticised Centre for dismissing a US panel's recent report on religious freedom in India. "Policy of BJP government is Gandhi in abroad and Godse in...[India]...On one hand, [they] want to tell everyone that we have...democracy...and on the other, they're crushing...democratic rights inside [India]," he said. Panel had termed India a "country of particular concern".

324.title: Was confused about my tactics: Top seed Swiatek on 3rd round Wimbledon loss
324.article_body: Commenting on her third round loss against unseeded Alize Cornet at Wimbledon, world number one Iga Swiatek, who was on a 37-match winning streak, said she was confused about her tactics. "What can I say? I know I didn't play good tennis," she added. The top seed hit 33 unforced errors to Cornet's seven in the 6-4, 6-2 defeat.

325.title: Heavy rainfall causes waterlogging, disrupts traffic in several parts of Delhi
325.article_body: Heavy rainfall lashed parts of Delhi, leading to traffic disruption and waterlogging in many parts on Sunday, as part of an ongoing wet spell with the onset of monsoon. Areas like Mandi House, Tilak Marg and Pragati Maidan were reportedly flooded after the rainfall. Delhi had received heavy rainfall on Thursday, which brought the temperature below 30 degrees Celsius.

326.title: Debina Bonnerjee, Gurmeet Choudhary share first pic of daughter
326.article_body: Television actors Debina Bonnerjee and Gurmeet Choudhary shared the first picture of their baby girl on social media on Sunday. The couple can be seen kissing their daughter's cheeks as she looks into the camera. Debina wrote, "Introducing Lianna. Our heart united into one." Lianna is Debina and Gurmeet's first child together and was born on April 3.

327.title: Tiger Shroff shares throwback training video, says 'The struggle was real'
327.article_body: Tiger Shroff, taking to Instagram, shared a throwback video from his acrobatics training session. "Man the struggle and grind [were] real! Found some old training footage of little me with not so little dreams and my quest to become...action hero," he wrote. Actor Bhakhtyar Irani reacted to the video, writing, "When he was a cub...looked dangerous to kill even then."

328.title: We don't make family entertainers due to influence by the West: Varun
328.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan stated in an interview that Bollywood has stopped making big-scale masala family entertainers because it is too influenced by the West. "No one knows what type of films will work, from the biggest producers to trade people," he added. The actor further said that after COVID-19, one has to do "what your conviction says".

329.title: Ronaldo wants to leave Man Utd; doesn't feel ambition: Italian journalist
329.article_body: Italian transfer journalist Fabrizio Romano has claimed that Manchester United footballer Cristiano Ronaldo wants to leave the English football club. "Ronaldo told Manchester United [that] he wants to leave this summer as he wants to see more ambition," Romano tweeted. He added that the 37-year-old footballer likes the club and its manager but doesn't feel the ambition.

330.title: I can hurt him on grass court: Nadal's next opponent Botic on their match
330.article_body: World number four Rafael Nadal's next opponent at Wimbledon Botic van de Zandschulp has said he can defeat the two-time Wimbledon champion on the grass court in their fourth-round match. "The biggest challenge in tennis is to play Nadal at French Open...but [I've] more confidence here to really make a shot...I can hurt him on the grass court," stated Zandschulp.

331.title: Media loves to write that I'm bad for tennis but clearly not: Kyrgios
331.article_body: Talking about his third round win against fourth seed Stefanos Tsitsipas at Wimbledon, unseeded Australian Nick Kyrgios said, "Hell of an atmosphere and an amazing match. I honestly felt like the favourite coming [into this match]." He added, "Everywhere I go I seem to be having full stadiums...media loves to write that I'm bad for the sport but clearly not."

332.title: 4 killed, 3 injured as cylinder explodes during Punjab wedding function
332.article_body: Four persons, including three women and one girl, were killed and three sustained injuries after a cylinder exploded during a wedding function in Punjab's Fazilka district. The explosion was caused due to a leak in the regulator of a gas cylinder, according to police. The injured persons are undergoing treatment at a hospital, police added.

333.title: 10-year-old rape victim denied abortion in US' Ohio after SC ends abortion rights
333.article_body: A 10-year-old rape victim was denied an abortion in Ohio after the Supreme Court of the US overturned the Roe vs Wade decision last month. A child abuse doctor in Ohio contacted an obstetrician-gynecologist in Indiana, after receiving the girl who was six weeks and three days pregnant. She is now travelling to Indiana for an abortion, the Hill reported.

334.title: 'Pushpa' composer DSP, Honey Singh team up for Salman's Bhaijaan: Reports
334.article_body: Music composer Devi Sri Prasad aka DSP, who composed music for Allu Arjun starrer 'Pushpa: The Rise', and rapper Honey Singh have reportedly teamed up for a peppy number in Salman Khan's 'Bhaijaan'. "The makers have already recorded the song, and some who have heard it insist that it would be an earworm for the audiences," reports stated.

335.title: Can't believe England haven't learnt from their mistakes: Vaughan
335.article_body: Former England skipper Michael Vaughan has criticised the English team for repeating mistakes that "happened at Lord's" Test in 2021. "You've got Stuart Broad and James Anderson...bowling to Jasprit Bumrah...They decide to go short with the field spread out...Can't believe they haven't learnt," Vaughan said. Notably, Broad went for 35 runs in an over against Bumrah at Edgbaston on Saturday.

336.title: Old is gold, a match-winner: Sehwag to Harbhajan on his 42nd birthday
336.article_body: Virender Sehwag took to Twitter to wish Harbhajan Singh on his 42nd birthday on Sunday and wrote, "Old is gold, wishing a match-winner and a guy who tries to keep the atmosphere jovial everywhere he goes." Gautam Gambhir tweeted, "Happy Birthday Bhajji pa! You may be done with bowling, but you can never be done with entertaining! Keep shining brother."

337.title: Virat Kohli sledges Jonny Bairstow, makes fun of him; video goes viral
337.article_body: Ex-Team India captain Virat Kohli was seen indulging in a verbal argument with England's Jonny Bairstow during the third day of the rescheduled fifth Test at Edgbaston. In a video that has gone viral, Kohli was heard saying, "Little bit faster than Southee...eh?" While, in another video, he was seen making fun of Bairstow after he missed a delivery.

338.title: IndiGo flights hit by delays across India over staff shortage, DGCA seeks clarification
338.article_body: IndiGo flight operations have been hit with massive delays across India due to the non-availability of crew members, reports said on Sunday. Aviation regulator DGCA has taken cognisance of the issue and sought a clarification/explanation from the airline, ANI reported citing DGCA officials. As many as 900 IndiGo flights have been affected due to staff shortage, ET Now reported.

339.title: India coach job for me was to prove media wrong: Shastri
339.article_body: Former India head coach Ravi Shastri has said that his coaching job with the Indian team for him was to prove the "media wrong". "The last thing I was worried about was media...The fact was that we were bullies at home and we didn't play great [overseas]. So my job...was to prove media wrong," Shastri said.

340.title: Incoming deliveries were bowled as part of strategy against Root: Zaheer
340.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Zaheer Khan praised Indian pacers for planning England batter Joe Root's wicket on Day 2 of their ongoing rescheduled Test. "Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammad Shami had a discussion...After that, incoming deliveries were bowled as part of the strategy," stated Zaheer. Mohammed Siraj dismissed Root for 31 with an incoming delivery that had some extra bounce.

341.title: Terrorism is raging because of Congress party: Shivraj Singh Chouhan
341.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Sunday said that terrorism is raging because of the Congress party. "In Udaipur, there was recently a killing in broad daylight. We will crush terrorism. We will run bulldozers over the miscreants," Chouhan added. Furthermore, Chouhan said that Congress is a party of "polarisation" and the country lost its respect under their rule.

342.title: PM Modi, Shah’s decision to make me CM opened eyes of many: Eknath Shinde
342.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Sunday said that the decision of PM Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah to make him the Chief Minister despite having more members than his side "has opened the eyes of many". "Everyone knows that Devendra Fadnavis had 115 members with him. I had only 50," he added.

343.title: What I saw was bizarre, something I never imagined: Shastri on Bumrah's world record
343.article_body: Talking about Jasprit Bumrah breaking the world record for scoring most runs in an over in Tests, ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said, "What I saw was bizarre." He added, "It’s something I’ve never imagined. The world record, from Bumrah, batting at number 10, as captain of India, for the first time." Bumrah scored 29 runs off Stuart Broad's over.

344.title: Twitter CEO takes coffee orders from staff during visit to UK office, pics surface
344.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal visited the company's office in the United Kingdom last week for a series of events. Employees took to Twitter to share photos of Agrawal taking coffee orders while another top Twitter executive, CFO Ned Segal served cookies along with it to the staff. The Managing Director of Twitter UK could also be seen with Agrawal.

345.title: Paris airport workers warn of another walkout from July 8 to 10
345.article_body: Paris airport workers, who have staged a series of strikes demanding higher salaries, have warned of another walkout from July 8-10, which can cause disruption for travellers. Earlier, airport operator ADP offered a 4% pay hike to the staff if they ended the ongoing strike. However, the workers rejected it saying it was not good enough.

346.title: Will test bullet that killed Al Jazeera reporter in West Bank: Israel
346.article_body: Israel said on Sunday that it'll test the bullet that killed a Palestinian-American journalist in May to determine whether one of its soldiers shot her. This comes after Palestine handed over the bullet to US experts after being reassured that Israel won't participate in ballistics test. The victim, Shireen Abu Akleh, was killed while covering a raid in West Bank.

347.title: Adele stops London concert midway to help fans, video viral
347.article_body: British singer Adele, who recently performed at London's BST Hyde Park Festival, stopped her performance four times to help fans. A viral video shows the singer asking the band to stop, walking to the front of the stage and directing security to the fans who needed help. This comes after 10 fans died during Travis Scott's Astroworld Festival in November.

348.title: Broad will always remember two names: Aakash on 35-run over in 5th Test
348.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said England's Stuart Broad will always remember two Indian players, Yuvraj Singh and Jasprit Bumrah. "Broad has created records which he won't be very proud of," added Chopra. Bumrah smashed Broad for the most expensive over in Test cricket history in the ongoing fifth Test, while Yuvraj had smashed him for six consecutive sixes in 2007.

349.title: Rebel MLAs were unable to look us in the eye: Aaditya Thackeray
349.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray on Sunday said that rebel MLAs, who returned to Mumbai from Goa, were unable to look Shiv Sena in the eye.
