"How long are you going to move from one hotel to the other? These MLAs will have to go to their Assembly constituencies one day. How will they face the people then?" he asked.

350.title: New York bans guns in many public places after Supreme Court order
350.article_body: The US' New York state has banned carrying guns in several public places, including Times Square. Under the new law, gun-licence seekers will be required to prove their shooting skills and submit their social media accounts for review by the government. This comes days after the US Supreme Court ruled against New York's restrictive gun-licence laws.

351.title: Next 30-40 years to be era of BJP: Union Home Minister Amit Shah
351.article_body: Union Home Minister and BJP leader Amit Shah said that the next 30-40 years will be the era of his party and India will become a “vishwa guru” (world leader). Furthermore, Shah, during the BJP's national executive meeting, said “dynastic politics, casteism and politics of appeasement” were the “greatest sins” and the reasons behind the country’s sufferings over the years.

352.title: Delhi Police bust fake call centre cheating US citizens, 12 held
352.article_body: Delhi Police busted a fake call centre involved in cheating US citizens on the pretext of redeeming gift cards and arrested 12 people. "On pointing out of informer a raid was conducted and it was found that a setup of computers and accessories were installed in the premises," said a police release. They presented themselves as Amazon representatives, it added.

353.title: Israel shoots down 3 Hezbollah drones heading towards gas field
353.article_body: The Israeli military said on Saturday that it had shot down three drones launched by the militant group Hezbollah. The Iran-backed Shi'ite group said in a statement that it had launched the unarmed drones towards the "disputed" Karish gas field for reconnaissance missions. "The message was delivered," Hezbollah added. One drone was intercepted by an Israeli fighter jet, AFP reported.

354.title: New sleeping pod hotel opens at Mumbai's CSMT station, pics released
354.article_body: Union Minister of Railways Ashwini Vaishnaw on Sunday shared photos of the newly-opened sleeping pod hotel at Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT) in Mumbai. This is the second such facility of the Indian Railways in Mumbai. The new hotel is expected to have a capacity of 50 people along with amenities like key card access, air conditioning, and CCTV surveillance.

355.title: Robbers steal computers from Odisha school, scrawl 'Dhoom 4' on blackboard
355.article_body: Miscreants robbed computers and other electronic items from a high school in Odisha's Nabarangpur district and scrawled phrases like "Dhoom 4", "we will return" and "coming soon" on a blackboard. 'Dhoom 4' is an upcoming Bollywood film, featuring police and thieves. The thieves also allegedly wrote "catch us if you can" in Odia on the blackboard.

356.title: The track was brought to me as a joke: Ishq Bector on Aye Hip Hopper
356.article_body: Rapper-music composer Ishq Bector, speaking about his song 'Aye Hip Hopper', said, "The track came together when Hanif Shaikh brought it to me as a joke about a star hip-hopper and a romantic angle with his maid." "But then it...kind of snowballed," he said, adding, "I presented...demo to Sunidhi Chauhan and she nearly fell off...chair laughing...and agreed to sing [it]."

357.title: Accepting Deputy CM post must be a 'real shocker' for Fadnavis: Shiv Sena
357.article_body: In an editorial of its mouthpiece 'Saamana', Shiv Sena has said that accepting the Deputy CM post must have been a "real shocker" for BJP's Devendra Fadnavis. "...The climax at the Raj Bhavan was the most shocking part...Fadnavis accepted the [Deputy CM] post as the party leadership's order. But now being said...that Fadnavis showed a big heart," the editorial said.

358.title: Tribal woman set ablaze over land dispute in MP, 2 arrested
358.article_body: A tribal woman suffered severe burn injuries after three people set her ablaze over a land dispute in MP's Guna district, police said on Sunday. A video, purportedly shot by the accused, surfaced online, wherein the charred woman was seen crying in pain, with smoke all around her. The police arrested two of the three accused.

359.title: List of state-wise active COVID-19 cases released
359.article_body: The Health Ministry on Sunday stated that there are 1,11,711 active COVID-19 cases in the country, with Kerala accounting for the highest number of active cases at 29,505. This is followed by Maharashtra (23,447), Tamil Nadu (13,319), West Bengal (9,290), Karnataka (6,440), Telangana (4,784), Gujarat (3,478), Delhi (3,410) and Uttar Pradesh (3,029).

360.title: Great taste my friend: Priyanka to kid who said he 'loves her' in TikTok video
360.article_body: Priyanka Chopra has reacted to a TikTok video where a child could be seen calling her pretty and saying he loves her. She shared the video on her Instagram Stories, writing, "Great taste my friend." The child was reacting to Priyanka's old picture from a 2017 article about her being declared the world's second most beautiful woman after a poll.

361.title: M-cap of 3 of top 10 most valued firms decline by ₹73,630 crore in past week
361.article_body: The market valuation of three of the 10 most valued domestic firms declined by ₹73,630.56 crore in past week. While Reliance Industries took the biggest hit and saw its valuation dipping by ₹62,100.95 crore to reach ₹16,29,684.50 crore. It was followed by ICICI Bank and HUL whose valuation dropped by ₹6,654.2 crore and ₹4,875.41 crore, respectively.

362.title: Is Bihar Police so incompetent?: Tejashwi after BJP tightens office security
362.article_body: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav criticised BJP for increasing security in its party offices in Bihar amid protests against Agnipath scheme and said that they don't have faith in their own "double engine government". "The Bihar government should tell us whether the police is so incompetent so as to warrant deployment of central forces at BJP offices?" asked Yadav.

363.title: 19 dead after bus falls into ravine in Pakistan amid heavy rains
363.article_body: At least 19 people were killed and several others were left injured after a bus veered off a mountainous road amid heavy rains and fell into a ravine in Pakistan's Balochistan province on Sunday. The bus, which was reportedly carrying 30 passengers, was headed from Islamabad towards Quetta. The injured persons have been admitted to hospital, an official said.

364.title: Gadkari shares pics of new 4-lane Goa-Karnataka coastal highway, calls it 'magnificent'
364.article_body: Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari shared pictures of the new four-lane Goa-Karnataka coastal highway on Twitter. "Magnificent due to its scenic view...this project is an important coastal highway link between west and south India," Gadkari stated. Gadkari added the four-laning of the highway is nearing completion, with 92.42% work already completed. He added the traffic is open on highway.

365.title: 27 missing as ship breaks in half amid typhoon in South China Sea, video surfaces
365.article_body: As many as 27 people are missing and feared dead as a massive ship broke into half and sank amid typhoon Chaba in the South China Sea. A video of the rescue has been released by the Hong Kong Government Flying Service and it shows some crew members being airlifted. The footage shows the offshore vessel partially submerged.

366.title: Kartik is the same person he was before Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2's success: Kriti
366.article_body: Kartik Aaryan on Saturday shared a video with Kriti Sanon. In the video, the two were promoting his film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. When asked if Kartik is the same guy he was before the success of the film, Kriti said Kartik continues to be the same person she knew before. "We don’t let him fly too high," Kriti jokingly added.

367.title: Varun Dhawan, Kiara Advani's 'JugJugg Jeeyo' earns ₹100 cr worldwide
367.article_body: Director Raj Mehta's 'JugJugg Jeeyo', which features Varun Dhawan, Kiara Advani, Anil Kapoor and Neetu Kapoor, has earned over ₹100 crore worldwide. The actors took to their respective social media handles to thank fans. As per trade analyst Taran Adarsh, the film has crossed ₹61.44 crore at the Indian box office and is likely to cross ₹65 crore on Sunday.

368.title: 2 boys drown while swimming in artificial farm reservoir in Pune
368.article_body: Two boys, aged 13 and 14, drowned while swimming in an artificial farm reservoir in Pune's Dhayari area on Sunday. A third boy, who didn't get into the reservoir as he didn't know swimming, raised an alarm and called locals for help, a fire officer said. The bodies of the two deceased were recovered, the fire officer added.

369.title: PMC to buy additional saplings worth ₹45 lakh for plantation drive
369.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) will purchase additional saplings worth ₹45 lakh for its planned tree plantation drive to increase the green cover in the city, according to officials. PMC Garden Department chief Ashok Ghorpade said that the drive was affected due to the delay in monsoons. "We have saplings at various nurseries, but we'll...purchase additional saplings," he added.

370.title: He is outstanding, a class act: Vaughan after Jadeja's 104-run innings
370.article_body: Former England captain Michael Vaughan has praised India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja for his 104-run innings against England in the ongoing rescheduled Test. "He's a class act. I was looking at his numbers over the last 20-odd Test matches. He's averaging 48, only second to Rohit Sharma," stated Vaughan. Jadeja's hundred helped India post 416 in the first innings.

371.title: 'Jai Jai KCR' balloons spotted near PM's meet venue in Secunderabad
371.article_body: Ahead of PM Narendra Modi's public meeting in Secunderabad's Parade Grounds on Sunday, 'Jai Jai KCR' balloons were spotted outside the venue. A video of the balloons has also surfaced online. This comes as political banners and posters, including a few inspired by the show 'Money Heist', among others, surfaced across various locations in Hyderabad recently.

372.title: Delhi govt gives 10-day grace period to comply with single-use plastic ban
372.article_body: The Delhi government has decided to be lenient towards those violating the ban on single-use plastic (SUP) items for the initial 10 days. It has launched a campaign to create awareness against the use of such commodities and promote their alternatives. The AAP-led government will also provide incentives to SUP manufacturing units willing to switch over to green alternatives.

373.title: 25-year-old Black man shot 60 times by police in US: Lawyer who watched bodycam footage
373.article_body: A 25-year-old Black man named Jayland Walker was shot over 60 times by police in Ohio after a pursuit over a traffic violation, the lawyer who watched body camera footage of the incident said. The footage will be released to the public on Sunday. The officers involved have been placed on administrative leave during an investigation, the department's statement said.

374.title: Even Kasab didn’t have so much security: Aaditya on protection for rebel Sena MLAs
374.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray reacted to security arrangements for rebel Shiv Sena MLAs and said that even terrorist Ajmal Kasab did not have such security. "We have not seen such security before in Mumbai. Why are you scared? Is someone going to run away?" Thackeray said. The rebel Shiv Sena MLAs reached Vidhan Bhavan in special buses today.

375.title: Italy's Venice becomes world's 1st city to announce entry fee for tourists
375.article_body: Italy's Venice has become the world's first city to announce an entry fee for tourists as it tries to tackle the problem of crowding and "overtourism". The city will charge a €3-€10 (₹247-₹823) entry fee from tourists starting January 16, 2023. Visitors will also have to make an online booking before travelling to Venice next year.

376.title: Rihanna makes first appearance in London after welcoming son
376.article_body: Singer Rihanna made her first public appearance after welcoming her baby boy with rapper A$AP Rocky at the Wireless Festival in London. A$AP Rocky was among the performers at the festival. Rihanna was seen in an all-black ensemble that included a puffer jacket with feathers all around the hoodie and black pants. The couple welcomed their son on May 13.

377.title: BJP made clear democracy is for sale: KC Venugopal on Maha political development
377.article_body: Following the political development in Maharashtra, Congress leader KC Venugopal said that BJP has made it clear that the democracy is for sale. "Anybody can come, take money and they get to join the BJP. This is the fate of democracy in India but the people of India will fight it," Venugopal added.

378.title: I hang my head in 'shame': Kapil Sibal on state of judiciary
378.article_body: Rajya Sabha MP Kapil Sibal on Sunday expressed concern over the current state of the judiciary, saying that some members of the institution have let us down, adding that he hangs his head in shame. Responding to the arrest of Mohammed Zubair, Sibal said it is "unthinkable" for a person to get arrested for a tweet from four years ago.

379.title: Viral video shows Swiggy delivery boy riding a horse to deliver order amid Mumbai rains
379.article_body: A video of a Swiggy delivery agent riding a horse to deliver an order amid heavy rainfall in Mumbai has gone viral on social media. Several people took to social media to praise the delivery agent for his dedication, with one user saying, "Now this is what I call 'Shahi delivery'." "Something rare to find," said another user.

380.title: Got the tag of Queen of Punjabi films because of Ravii's manifestation: Sargun
380.article_body: Actress Sargun Mehta, who was seen in 'Saunkan Saunkne', spoke about her husband Ravii Dubey's role in her success. "I manifested coming in...Punjabi industry with my dreams, but if there’s ever a tag of Queen [of Punjabi films] attached to me, that’ll be Ravii’s manifestation," she said. "Since the time we've been together, that's all he's told me," she added.

381.title: Belarus claims to have intercepted missiles from Ukraine
381.article_body: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko claimed that the country intercepted missiles launched by Ukrainian forces a few days ago. Belarus did not want war with Ukraine, but would fight if its territory was invaded, Lukashenko said, according to state media. "They are provoking us…An attempt to strike military facilities on Belarusian territory was made from the territory of Ukraine," he said.

382.title: Mahesh Babu praises Haasan's 'Vikram', calls it 'new-age cult classic'
382.article_body: Actor Mahesh Babu took to Twitter to pen a note praising Kamal Haasan's recently released movie 'Vikram'. Calling it a "new-age cult classic", he wrote, "Lokesh Kanagaraj (director), would love to catch up with you and discuss the entire process of Vikram." He also praised the performances of actors Vijay Sethupathi, Fahadh Faasil and Kamal Haasan.

383.title: We're in Wimbledon for a stroll: Venus to reporter asking 'are you in it to win it'
383.article_body: During a press conference at Wimbledon 2022, Venus Williams, who's playing the mixed doubles event alongside Jamie Murray, was asked if the two were "in it to win it" or "for the experience" at the tournament. Jamie Murray responded with a smile saying, "We're better than that, come on." Venus replied sarcastically saying, "We're in it for a stroll."

384.title: Man arrested for killing homeless man in hit-and-run case in Delhi
384.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly killing a homeless man in a hit-and-run accident in Delhi's Outer district. The accused, identified as Ashok (31), allegedly crushed the victim's head after a tyre of the generator, which was attached to his car, ran over the victim, the Mangolpuri Police said. Notably, the unidentified deceased lived on footpaths, police added.

385.title: Man climbs wall, enters CM Mamata's residence in Kolkata late at night; arrested
385.article_body: A massive security breach took place at the residence of West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee in Kolkata's Kalighat on Saturday late night, after a man allegedly entered its premises by crossing over a wall. The man remained on the premises throughout the night and was arrested by police personnel, who spotted him on Sunday morning, officers said.

386.title: Amber calls $10mn awarded to Johnny 'excessive' in new appeal to dismiss verdict
386.article_body: Amber Heard has filed a fresh court appeal to either dismiss the June defamation trial verdict won by her ex-husband Johnny Depp, or start a new trial. The filing called the $10.35 million awarded to Depp "excessive", saying there was "no evidence" to substantiate it. She also cited 'poor legal reasoning' and 'improperly vetted jury' as reasons for verdict's dismissal.

387.title: Jadeja reminds Anderson of 2014 spat after 'He can bat like a proper batter now' remark
387.article_body: Team India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja reacted to England fast bowler James Anderson's remark that he can now bat like a proper batter following his century in the Edgbaston Test. "It's nice Jimmy Anderson has realised that after 2014...so I'm happy," Jadeja said. Notably, Anderson had allegedly abused and pushed Jadeja during the first Test at Trent Bridge in 2014.

388.title: Activists, Oppn protest new Maha govt's car shed plan in Mumbai's Aarey
388.article_body: Climate activists and the Opposition called for a peaceful protest at Mumbai's Aarey forest on Sunday morning, following which hundreds of citizens gathered at the spot. This comes after the newly-formed state government's decision to relocate Metro 3 car shed to Aarey Milk colony. "I humbly urge the new government to reconsider its decision," former minister Aaditya Thackeray tweeted.

389.title: Milind makes music video comeback after 25 yrs, says 'It was super fun'
389.article_body: Actor-model Milind Soman has made a comeback in a music video titled 'Shringaar'. Sharing his experience, Milind said it was "super fun" to do a music video after 25 years. "When 'Shringaar' came my way, I instantly loved...[it] and wanted to be...part of it," he added. Composed by Vayu, the song has been sung by Akasa, Aastha Gill and Raftaar.

390.title: BJP-Sena govt has taken charge, based on beliefs of Balasaheb Thackeray: Shinde
390.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Sunday said that the BJP-Shiv Sena government has taken charge, based on the beliefs of Balasaheb Thackeray. "I myself was a minister, several other ministers too left the government. This was a huge thing for a common worker like me who was devoted to the ideology of Balasaheb Thackeray and Anand Dighe," he added.

391.title: Headmaster accused of secretly filming female teachers hits them with stones in UP
391.article_body: A headmaster in UP's Bareilly has been suspended after a video of him attacking female teachers with stones went viral on social media. Khurshid Ali has been accused of secretly filming teachers, who he claims were working on their laptops rather than teaching children. Police said that a probe has been initiated against Ali in connection with the incident.

392.title: Punjab National Bank hikes FD interest rates on selected tenors from July 4
392.article_body: Punjab National Bank has increased interest rates on fixed deposits below ₹2 crore. Effective from July 4, it has increased rates on deposits with a maturity of 1-2 years and up to 3 years by 10 to 20 basis points. Deposits of 1-2 years will fetch a 5.30% interest rate, up by 10 basis points from 5.20%.

393.title: Always put Aus cricket in front; IPL, BBL taken backseat: Starc
393.article_body: Australian pacer Mitchell Starc has said that he always puts Australian cricket "in front" and for that, IPL and BBL have taken a "backseat". "I will always keep Australian cricket...and then franchise cricket...I have looked at the Australian schedule and want to be as fit and well-performed for that," Starc said after opting out of the upcoming BBL season.

394.title: We've often seen a partnership after England's 5th wicket falls: Jaffer
394.article_body: After England ended Day 2 of fifth Test against India at 84/5 in Edgbaston, Wasim Jaffer said a partnership has often been seen following the fall of hosts' fifth wicket. "India will have to stop that in...morning. This partnership between Jonny Bairstow and Ben Stokes is very important. If these wickets fall quickly, India will be in control," he added.

395.title: 3 Hyd metro stations to be closed during PM Modi's public meeting
395.article_body: Ahead of PM Narendra Modi's public meeting in Secunderabad on Sunday, metro stations of Paradise, Parade Grounds and JBS will be closed between 5:30 pm and 8 pm. Trains won't halt at these stations during this duration amid security concerns, Hyderabad Metro Rail Limited announced. Trains plying on Corridor 2 will ply between Secunderabad West and MGBS during this time.

396.title: Kohli might be praying for such clarity: Manjrekar on Jadeja's knock vs Eng
396.article_body: Commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has said Virat Kohli might be praying to have the same clarity that Ravindra Jadeja had in his 104-run innings against England in the ongoing Test. "Jadeja was leaving the balls even slightly outside the off-stump, was playing them when it was close to off-stump and driving the pitched-up deliveries," explained Manjrekar. Kohli got out for 11(19).

397.title: Lower Byrasandra lake restoration to be over by next month: BBMP official
397.article_body: Restoration work being carried out at Bengaluru's Lower Byrasandra lake, also known as the Kelagina Kere, will get over by the next month, a BBMP executive engineer (lakes department) said. The civic body started the restoration work last year. An activist said that BBMP should also "concentrate" on Upper Byrasandra lake, which is about 200 metre from Lower Byrasandra lake.

398.title: Man promises to sell gold at inexpensive price, cheats 20 persons of ₹75 lakh in MP
398.article_body: A man from West Bengal allegedly cheated over 20 persons in MP on promise of selling them gold at an inexpensive price. The accused collected over ₹75 lakh from the victims, according to police. He had an office, that remains closed now, in MP Nagar from where he ran his business. According to police, efforts are underway to nab him.

399.title: China renews yellow alert as rainstorms hit some regions
399.article_body: China renewed a yellow alert on Sunday as severe rainstorms struck some parts of the country. The weather department has predicted rainstorms in parts of Guangdong, Guangxi, Hunan and Hubei regions. It has advised local governments to prepare for the heavy downpour and to check the drainage systems. It has also suggested authorities to take appropriate traffic control measures.

400.title: Akhilesh dissolves all SP executive units, except party's UP chief post
400.article_body: Samajwadi Party (SP) chief Akhilesh Yadav has dissolved all of the party's national, state and district executive bodies, except its Uttar Pradesh President post, with immediate effect. "National presidents, state presidents, district presidents of all...party's organisations, including youth and women's wings, have also been dissolved," SP tweeted. However, SP didn't give any reason for the move.
